boardgame.name: Alien Character Deck
boardgame.description:
Back of the Box

From Outer Space

Sterfinder Alien Character Deck places the diverse species of the galaxy at your fingertips! Whether you're a player who wants an easy reminder of your character's racial traits or a Game Master looking to quickly populate a cantina on a distant world with strange science-fantasy aliens, this deck of 55 cards presents more than 50 playable races, including five new species never bofore seen in Starfinder! Each card features a beautiful full-color image of a Strfinder alien on one side, with racial traits for player characters on the other side for quick reference. Bring your games to life with a little something extraterrestrial!

boardgame.name: Taken by The Shadows: Professional Level
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A plagued city, a rogue with supernatural abilities.

Play an adventure solo or with one more person, doing stealthy "jobs" as a mysterious criminal to accomplish your multiple plans.
boardgame.rpgitemversion: Taken by the Shadows: Professional Level
Tomado por Las Sombras: Nivel Profesional

boardgame.name: Motif Story Engine
boardgame.description:
MSE is a tool used to enhance the experience of your favorite roleplaying game. It is game neutral (or system agnostic). Most any RPG with a randomizer can be used.

MSE is designed for storygamers and roleplayers to ease the moderator (“GM”) role (GM-lite) or enable solo play outright. The core module is a question & answer oracle system.

Attribution: Introduction from release PDF

boardgame.name: Mission: Live «The Ruskvan Invasion»
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A war drama about a guerrilla that is the last stand against an army of mechs.

Based on the "Professional Level" system, it is easy to learn and uses only six-sided dice. Play a guerrilla managing the last resources of the Resistance in Missions against giant mechs of different types.

boardgame.name: Igni Ferroque: Great Battles of the Ancient World – Volume I
boardgame.description:
Igni Ferroque: Great Battles of the Ancient World places some of the most important battles in the ancient world at your fingertips.

Complete maps, descriptions and army compositions that can be used with any Ancient rules set.

The sands of time reveal the struggle of power and control for those who dare.

Includes extra rules for SCUTARII.

23 Battles featured:
KADESH 1300 B.C.
MARATHON 490 B.C.
ASCULUM 279 A.D.
CALLINICUM 531 A.D.
BIBRACTE 58 B.C.
MAGNESIA 190 B.C.
TREBIA 218 B.C.
PLATAEA 479 B.C.

CHALONS 451 A.D.

BABYLON 1225 B.C.
AD DECIMUM 533 A.D.

RAPHIA 217 B.C.
PARAITAKANE 317/316 B.C.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: History: Wars in the Ancient Near East
History: Wars of Alexander the Great
History: Wars of the Diadochi and Syrian Wars

boardgame.name: Ten-Twenty Grand
boardgame.description:
Players attempt to reach a score of either 10,000 or 20,000 through rolls of six dice. Players must roll a minimum score of 500 and roll at least a one or a five to start in order to continue scoring. Subsequent rolls may be taken, though a player risks their scores by doing so. With each successive roll, players must roll a one or a five in order to keep scoring points. Point values vary depending on what type of roll a player gets (three of a kind, small straight, etc.), except for rolling six fives or six ones.

In the case of rolling six fives, a player automatically reaches 10,000 points and becomes winner pro-tem. The remaining players each get one final turn in an attempt to beat that players’ score. In the event of rolling six ones, a player automatically receives 20,000 points, and gameplay follows the same as if a player rolls six fives. The player with the highest score exceeding 10,000 or 20,000 wins.

boardgame.name: Star Power!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Star Power! is a Role Playing Game Core book that gives you all the the rules you need to play thrilling adventures in your favorite movies! Using a unique 8d10 system, Star Power! uses a multiple action round that feels fast and fun like the best of Hollywood! Make one-off movies, sequels, and long term campaigns as your actors try on different roles and you never get bored!

Why? Because Star Power! isn't one setting or style! It is whatever your group is in the mood for that day. Comedy or drama, spies or spaceships. Star Power! works as any action genre from swords and spells fantasy to chrome and neon cyberpunk, just use the included guidance to craft your movie settings, summon your actors, and call action!

boardgame.name: Domaniacal
boardgame.description:
Domaniacal is a fast paced, 2-5 player strategy card game. Played with domino cards, players take turns removing cards from their hands and stealing from other players to create a stack of cards. Once the draw pile is out, the player with the largest stack wins!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Mind Blank
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Since the end of the red war in Mulmaster, the factions have been nursing their wounds. They no longer have the resources and pull to send large groups of adventures to retake a city or overthrow a government. Reduced to posting handbills the factions have located a secret dungeon that may hold the secret to regaining a measure of their status and power in the Moonsea. You have all arrived at the call of these handbills that promise powerful magics and rewards if you can succeed.

A 4 hour adventure for Tier two Adventurers Levels 5-10 (APL 8) for D&D Adventurers League.

boardgame.name: Memory Leak
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Since the end of the red war in Mulmaster, the factions have been nursing their wounds. They no longer have the resources and pull to send large groups of adventures to retake a city or overthrow a government. Reduced to posting handbills the factions have located a secret dungeon that may hold the secret to regaining a measure of their status and power in the Moonsea. You have all arrived at the call of these handbills that promise powerful magics and rewards if you can succeed.

A 4 hour adventure for Tier three Adventurers Levels 11-16 (APL 13) for D&D Adventurers League.

boardgame.name: The Goblin Mine
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The party finds an entrance to the old dwarven mine with plenty of small tracks leading inside. Whatever caused them to venture into the depths of its darkness, be it gold, mission or a diety, they will have to fight their way ahead and avoid dangerous traps and hazards, while filling the pockets full of gold, trinkets and baubles, getting drunk on the thrill of adventure.

Hello Adventurers! The Goblin Mine is a low level adventure (1-2).

boardgame.name: Ruins of the Fallen Kingdom
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Caught unprepared, the Dungeon Master faced her players as they planned an uncalled-for journey to Luskan. The adventurers were hired to find a thief in Waterdeep and an unfortunate mention of a sage living in Luskan pushed them in the wrong direction. Now what? Fear not! Use the material here to improvise a session they’ll never forget. Save the Dungeon Master was designed for this purpose exactly – just a couple of pages allowing you to keep the campaign going, buying you time to get it back on track again. Drop any of these episodes into your campaign when needed. When combined, they form a mini-campaign of their own, an arc to complement your own story…these pages are modeled after Chris Perkin’s advice on how to organize your campaign notes. All you need is the core books, some imagination and a willingness to wing it!

boardgame.name: Faces of Evil
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Caught unprepared, the Dungeon Master faced her players as they planned an uncalled-for journey to Luskan. The adventurers were hired to find a thief in Waterdeep and an unfortunate mention of a sage living in Luskan pushed them in the wrong direction. Now what? Fear not! Use the material here to improvise a session they’ll never forget. Save the Dungeon Master was designed for this purpose exactly – just a couple of pages allowing you to keep the campaign going, buying you time to get it back on track again. Drop any of these episodes into your campaign when needed. When combined, they form a mini-campaign of their own, an arc to complement your own story…these pages are modeled after Chris Perkin’s advice on how to organize your campaign notes. All you need is the core books, some imagination and a willingness to wing it!

boardgame.name: A Fistful of Dragons
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Caught unprepared, the Dungeon Master faced her players as they planned an uncalled-for journey to Luskan. The adventurers were hired to find a thief in Waterdeep and an unfortunate mention of a sage living in Luskan pushed them in the wrong direction. Now what? Fear not! Use the material here to improvise a session they’ll never forget. Save the Dungeon Master was designed for this purpose exactly – just a couple of pages allowing you to keep the campaign going, buying you time to get it back on track again. Drop any of these episodes into your campaign when needed. When combined, they form a mini-campaign of their own, an arc to complement your own story…these pages are modeled after Chris Perkin’s advice on how to organize your campaign notes. All you need is the core books, some imagination and a willingness to wing it!

boardgame.name: One Shot - The Juggernaut
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

A challenging encounter for 4-6 characters levels 10-12.

What can the party do against something that seems to be immune to taking damage? The party had better put on their thinking caps because they will surely die if they rely on the old "hack-and-slash" as their only strategy.

This product is designed especially for when you're bored with the "kill it and loot it" monotony.

It brings a bit of intelligence and special circumstances to your players in order to present a challenge requiring them to use actual strategy. If they refuse to step outside their "kill it, loot it" philosophy they will pay a harsh price.

boardgame.name: Cirria's Gambit
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Cirria’s Gambit is a fiendishly fun feast for 2nd-4th level characters, designed for D&D 5E. You can run this as a six- to eight-hour adventure and you will find additional material here to weave into your on-going campaign if you and your players enjoy the party - stay as long as you like!

This adventure takes you and your players out on a party - "Cirria's Gambit" is rife with ingrigue and party high-jinx! When an unusually intelligent succubus who is too kind for hell and a regal banshee with a strict sense of tradition and duty clash, the party better have some guests who are capable of negotiation and deduction as much as combat. While your players navigate snobbish nobles and intoxicated socialites, they have to untangle what goes on behind the scenes of this feast and decide who the baddies are...

boardgame.name: A Favor for Flizel
boardgame.description:
The prequel for The Sunken Tomb campaign

Publisher's blurb:

Here your party of adventurers will meet Flizel. A worldly mage and a colorful character with many magical surprises. The party meets him at an inn of course and he asks them for a favor... Into the forest to try and track down the missing people from a group headed south to meet him.

Explore a bit of the Cloakwood area as your party discovers new wondrous magical items and some creatures rarely seen.

boardgame.name: The Sunken Tomb of Voldesh
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Sunken Tomb is a large dungeon crawl that involves furious combat and a lengthy mystery. Flizel Westerwind wants to hire the party to find a missing book. Unknown to the party he had also sent another group to find it days earlier, but they turned out to be evil and slowly turned on their own to keep all the riches.

As the party finds the book in the tomb, they soon realize it is missing several pages. Flizel employs them to find the additional pages.

The party is sent off north to an Ogre camp to seek them where a well-armed fort awaits.

What is this book exactly? And where are all the pages? What happened to the other group of evil adventures? These and many more questions come up with the answers slow coming.

A dark force is at hand here. More than just the other random treasure hunters Flizel hired before.

This is part one of a three-part adventure and is designed for four 3rd level characters. Future parts progress at starting levels.

boardgame.name: Book Bound
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

After finding the book and discovering it had several pages missing, Flizel sends the party on to find the rest of the pages.

The party has to deal with the original party sent to retrieve the book. And they find out a dark force is at work here who also seeks the book. The manual contains strong magics that if in the wrong hands will cause chaos all across the realms!

Traveling south they interact with a temple for Torm and Bahamut, encounter a Fortune teller caravan and explore an ancient burial cave full of Gnolls and other creatures.

boardgame.name: The Pit and the Fiend
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to the final installment of the Sunken Tomb of Voldesh! Follow Flizel and his cast of NPCs deal with the magical tome and the evil drow that seeks to gain its powers. Inturn she has plans to use it to tap a great fiends powers and make them her own!

Your players will visit Cormyr and many towns and cities within the country along their way.

The party, if successful will gain a few powerful allies and magical items at the end of the adventure. They will come in handy for the next series of "Favors" Flizel will ask them to help with.

boardgame.name: Mystical Devices and Wondrous Creations
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

[G]reat magical items to use in your campaign! plit up into tiers of magical power.

boardgame.name: Mystical Devices and Wondrous Creations Volume 2
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

[G]rand magical items to use in your campaign! plit up into tiers of magical power.

boardgame.name: Mystical Devices and Wondrous Creations Volume 3
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

With over 15 new items and a new item type, this book will add greatly to your campaign! Each book is split into low, medium, high and relic categories.

boardgame.name: Mystical Devices and Wondrous Creations Volume 4
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Welcome to volume #4 in a series of grand magical items for your campaign!

With over 15 new items and a new item type, this book will add greatly to your campaign! Each book is split into low, medium, high and relic categories.

boardgame.name: Mystical Devices and Wondrous Creations Volume 5
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

With 16 new items, this book will add greatly to your campaign! plit into low, medium, high and relic categories.

boardgame.name: The Feral Hunt
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Baphomet has a grudge to settle, and he's taken your friends hostage to force a contest. Can you rescue your friends and escape his maze before he's able to hunt you down? Venture into overgrown jungle ruins in a section of Baphomet's maze. Dodge traps, solve puzzles, and survive a series of encounters before a final standoff against the Demon Lord himself. Will you stand and fight? Or will you outrun him and earn your freedom?

boardgame.name: The Ultimate RPG Game Master's Worldbuilding Guide
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Level up your Game Master skills with these fun, interactive prompts and activities to help your worldbuilding from RPG expert James D’Amato.

Make your next campaign truly unique with the help of this interactive guide to world building!

From RPG expert James D’Amato comes a fun new guide that teaches beginner and experienced gamers alike how to build and create their own game elements for customizing existing adventures or creating new stories from scratch. The Ultimate RPG Game Master’s Worldbuilding Guide includes dozens of activities for a wide range of genres from fantasy and sci-fi to horror and x-punk. This lively and interactive book helps Game Masters create dynamic destinations, powerful items, shadowy organizations, compelling villains, and more.

Make the most of your gaming experience with these unique and personalized ideas for your gaming group’s next adventures!

boardgame.name: Zombicide: Undead or Alive – Wooden Dice Set
boardgame.description:
This Kickstarter Exclusive Optional Buy brings you a pack of 6 custom wooden dice. These have the same design as the upgraded core box dice: a cowboy hat-wearing zombie head for 1, a lit dynamite stick for 6, and playing card suits for 2 to 5. However, these special dice have symbols in both red and black, following the traditional playing card look.

(Description from KS page)

boardgame.name: School Year Diary: NTK class
boardgame.description:
A co-op, school-themed, competitive, puzzle game for 1-4 players.

You are a teacher, an energized person loving school and classroom. You have desires to direct your students torward the best outcome. Each student brings their unique personality to each classroom. Each unlocked event brings new challenges for all members of the class.

You are going to:

Give out directives and all students will follow. They listen to you.
Collect unique items by unlocking experiences of your students. They share with you.
Collect medals when your students achieve the maximum score of a subject. You are rewarded.


In Co-op mode (Cooperative), all players win together after collecting all medal rows on board.
In Comp mode (Competitive), the 1 winner is determined by comparisons: have the most victory points (VP), have their turn earlier.

The games featured random starting deck for each unique replay. The puzzle combinations, the directives in teachers' hand, the events and experiences to be unfold in each play are totally different.

All students from the game add their personality to the progress of the game. Each student is unique, dependant to each other, you can play with any combinations you like.
Because of that, players can actually design and print out their own students, their experiences and add to the game. Notes: the cards's designs do not need to follow the same as the game.

The game mechanics revolve around basic geometric puzzle. Allow players to be flexible to enjoy learning the game earlier and mastering the game later.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Odemkni! Hrdinská dobrodružství: Na stopě bílého králíka
Unlock!: Heroic Adventures – Hinunter in den Kaninchenbau
boardgame.description:
Come with us to Wonderland and discover its unique inhabitants. Don't be late!

In live escape rooms, participants are locked in and must manage to leave the room within 60 minutes. UNLOCK! lets you experience this cooperative experience at your home gaming table.

Contained in Unlock!: Heroic Adventures but a German edition was released by itself.

boardgame.name: Odemkni!: Hrdinská dobrodružství – Vhoďte minci
Unlock!: Heroic Adventures – Insert Coin
boardgame.description:
Complete all levels in this virtual adventure.

Otherwise it's game over!

In live escape rooms, participants are locked in and must manage to leave the room within 60 minutes. UNLOCK! lets you experience this cooperative experience at your home gaming table.

Contained in Unlock!: Heroic Adventures but a German edition was released by itself.

Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes: In it's original packaging

boardgame.name: Sulphur & Snuff
boardgame.description:
From the publishers blurb:

A wicked theatre, a blue-skinned vizier, an imprisoned demon, evil noblemen and lots of torture, mutilation and cannibalism (and more within!). Sulphur and Snuff - A Devilish Performance is a rather horrible 11-page dungeon with horror and heist elements for Old School games. It would be a good fit for Lamentations of the Flame Princess or Mörk Borg.

boardgame.name: Lonely Cairn
boardgame.description:
Lonely Cairn is a solitaire game about finding the Northwest Passage in the mid 1800s. Modelled and based upon the ill-fated Franklin Expedition, players will need to equip their expedition and carefully chose what to take with them into the arctic. They will then sail though a channel of icy locations, facing deadly encounters along the way. They must reach the exit by the end of 8 turns, or face being locked in the ice forever.

This is a print-and-play game, with two main decks of cards, some tokens and a series of location cards. All components (and some alternatives) are provided in the PNP files. Expect your first expedition to take around 30min, with follow up games lasting around 15-20min. There are a million ways to die in the Arctic, so carefully choose your supplies and read the ice well, and you just might secure the coveted prize of discovering the fabled Northwest Passage.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Death Roads: All Stars
boardgame.description:
In 2082, mankind is divided. The rich and the lucky ones live in large, automated metropolises. The poor dwell in the outlands, struggling to survive. What gives a chance for a better life is the Death Roads car tournament - the main prize of which is citizenship. However, drivers' lives are at stake! Are you ready to risk it all in the Divided States of America's most daring trial?

Take part in a dangerous race! Pick your car, a driver and a set of deadly weapons. Your decisions will determine what unique cards you will be able to play, so be prepared for every possibility. Adjust your gear, accelerate, shoot and bash your opponents, everything to be the first - or the only one - on the finish line!

A crazy and deadly drive from West to East Coast will be full of unexpected road events. You will also have to be careful about the skids that can ruin your plans. In Death Roads: All Stars, every move is important and can bring you closer to victory or demise.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Death Roads: All Stars – Expansion 1: Goons and Guns
Death Roads: All Stars – Expansion 2: Riders in the Storm
Death Roads: All Stars – Power Up!

boardgame.name: Patrons of the Frontiers of Space
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a supplement for use with Cepheus Engine.

Patrons of the Frontiers of Space is a list of 100 potential patrons for use with my "Frontiers of Space" published previously. These are patrons specific to the Sonora sector of space but they could easily be modified for use elsewhere.

boardgame.name: Rift Breaker
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Celestial Geometry and Elemental Convergence!

Get new options for your Starfinder spellcasters to tap into the raw power of the elemental planes through mastery of the movements and geometries of the celestial firmament with the fantastic rift breaker archetype, offering nearly 40 elemental exploits and synergies with air, earth, fire, water, wood, and aether, from guidance of the stars and rapid recurrence to elemental surge and rift break!

boardgame.name: Supraland Crash
boardgame.description:
User Summary

Crash is a new Supraland adventure campaign.

boardgame.name: Illusions of Prestige
boardgame.description:
In the trick-taking game Illusions of Prestige, the magician players battle it out on stage with their best tricks, with the winner of a trick receiving points while losers gain support from apprentices and gather props to use for rule-breaking illusions.

The game lasts one or three hands as you prefer. At the start of a hand, shuffle the deck of 54 cards — the standard 52-card deck, plus high and low jokers — then deal 13 cards to each player. (With two players, each player draws two cards, keeps one of them, draws two more cards, keeps one, etc. until each player has 13 cards.)

The lead player of a hand plays a card, and everyone must follow suit if possible; if they can't, they can play any card. The highest card in the suit led wins the trick, and whoever played this card places it to the right of their player sheet.

Every other player looks at the props depicted on the card they played, marks off each prop on their player sheet, then places their card to the left of this sheet. A player sheet has a number of special powers (illusions) listed on it, with 3-5 props underneath each illusion. As soon as you've marked off all the props on an illusion, you can use it, whether now or in the future. What's more, each player who lost the trick takes an apprentice token and places it in their reserve, where they can have up to three tokens. You can add these tokens to cards played in future tricks to increase the value of your played card. Transform a 10 into a Jack, Queen, or King!

At the end of the hand, score points as follows:

• For each card used to win a trick, 5 points.
• For each completed illusion, 3-5 points based on the number of props.
• For each suit, whoever has the most cards of this suit to the left of their player sheet scores 2 points for each card; ties are friendly.

After you've played the proper number of hands, whoever has the highest score wins.

In the solo game of Illusions of Prestige, you deal two hands of 13 cards, look at them both, then keep one of them, shuffling the other one to represent your opponent. When you lead a trick, you flip cards from the opposing deck until you find one of the matching suit. When the opponent leads, you deal two cards and use the higher one. Cycle through discards as needed.

boardgame.name: Roped In
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A simple request to find a family heirloom drives the PCs into a small cavern complex full of mutated abominations and natural hazards. Can they find the lost ring before they fall prey to an undead menace and its progeny?

Roped In is a mini-adventure for the Fifth Edition of the World's Oldest Roleplaying Game suitable for four 8th level characters. It is designed to be used with Tangible Taverns: The Bull & The Bear.

This Tavern Tale includes a map of the cave complex, four new stat blocks, and a table of mutations for undead.

boardgame.name: Cathedral
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The time for toleration has ended."

The Cathedral is a sprawling forest of decorated towers and spires, topped with five ringing bells that chime at midday. Even in the street, the scent of incense fills the air. But despite its magnificence, the church is rotting from within. If the rot is allowed to grow, the city will pay the price.

This is a system-agnostic location, complete with descriptions, map, one-page dungeon and for GMs and Players alike. The location features a unique and easy-to-reference layout to help GMs start and build adventures. And it’s not just for GMs! Certain players will find the location helpful for giving their characters deep backstory.

Features:

A map location that can be dropped into any adventure that needs a cathedral
A renegade cleric, with problems and quests that need solving
Descriptions and more!


NOTE: The Cathedral is excerpted from THE CASTLE DISTRICT MAP+NPC PACK.

boardgame.name: The Oni
The Oni Race Guide
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Opposites Attract!

The red and blue oni are the race of twin brutes bonded by a shared soul. Split along lines of law and chaos, red and blue oni bicker like siblings but are thicker than thieves. Play this new race for Pathfinder 1st edition today!

Includes:

Red and Blue Oni Racial Traits: While both oni, red and blue oni have small differences that set them apart from one another. Alternative racial traits included!
Alternate Racial Traits: Subvert expectations and modify your racial traits!
Oni Favored Class Bonuses: Enjoy thematic bonuses for classes from both the Paizo and LRGG library!
Oni Racial Feats: Utilize your oni heritage to the fullest! Learn to fire energy bolts from your eyes! Wield greatswords in one hand!

boardgame.name: Layer of Eggs
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Layer of Eggs introduces an entirely new adversary for use with Shadow of the Demon Lord. Here, I reached out to the incredibly talented Kim Van Deun to illustrate a creature from her imagination and then I created a story around the creature including the mechanics needed to use the thing in the game. What Kim turned over was a bizarre eyeless humanoid spider thing with a ring of teeth in its face, a fleshy sac on its back, and a bizarre organ that excretes eggs presumably to hatch into something of equal, awful significance. Shown in a cave, the image proposed some terrible underground thing that would cause considerable trouble for spelunkers, miners, and other deep delvers. I found it quite easy to whip up an interesting story to the illustration and the product of our collaboration continues on the next page.

boardgame.name: Strange Things (2.0 - 5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of strange things to add to your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Strange Things is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

boardgame.name: Strange Things (2.0 - OSR)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of strange things to add to your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Strange Things is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

boardgame.name: Strange Things (2.0 - PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of strange things to add to your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Strange Things is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

boardgame.name: Strange Things (2.0 - PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This instalment of Dungeon Dressing presents loads of strange things to add to your dungeon. Designed to be used both during preparation or actual play, Dungeon Dressing: Strange Things is an invaluable addition to any GM's armoury!

boardgame.name: Garnoras Mountain & other fantastic adventures
La montagne de Garnoras & autres aventures fantastiques
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A forgotten mine,
an investigation about unnatural vengeance,
an eternal fight…
And a cursed mountain !

At the end of each month, discover the "Monsters of the MONTH", containing all the scenario from the past months, but implemented and augmented, exclusive hand-outs and a special scenario !
All the scenario included are quick to read and easy to add to your play nights, whether to complete an ongoing campaign, to start one or simply for a one-shot !
They are not written for a specific system or universe in order to let you modify and develop them at will.


Une mine oubliée,
une enquête de vengeance surnaturelle,
un conflit éternel…
Et une montagne maudite !

A la fin de chaque mois, découvrez le "Monsters of the MONTH", contenant tout les scénarios du mois, mais augmenté, des aides de jeux exclusives et un scénario spécial !

Tout les scénarios sont rapide à lire et facile à ajouter à vos soirées jeux, que ce soit pour complèter une campagne en cours, en commencer une ou simplement pour un one-shot !
Ils ne sont pas écrit pour un système ou un univers spécifique, afin de vous permettre de les modifier et les adapter au besoin.
boardgame.rpgitemversion: Garnoras Mountain & other fantastic adventures PDF
La montagne de Garnoras & autres aventures fantastiques PDF

boardgame.name: Advanced Premier Soccer
boardgame.description:
Advanced Premier Soccer is a dice-driven simulation of English Premier League soccer based on actual league and player statistics and suitable for either solitaire or competitive play. Advanced Premier Soccer upgrades and expands the game system developed in the original Premier Soccer by including factors such as shot location, man marking, individual defensive ratings, professional fouls, and revised durability and fatigue rules for league play.

Players take on the role of the manager - choosing a tactical formation and playing style, selecting a lineup, determining marking priorities, making changes in personnel and/or tactics, and dealing with the issues of player discipline and fatigue. The basic unit of play is the possession - defined as a period of extended control in the opponent's half of the pitch that may result in a shot. A typical game features 30-40 possessions and takes about 40-45 minutes to complete.

All team and player ratings are based on actual statistics from the 2019-2020 EPL season. Team sets for 2020-2021 will be made available following the conclusion of the current season.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Heroic Dark Deluxe
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Your world will fall unless you risk it all.

Heroic Dark is a genre-flexible game engine for telling high tension stories about danger, death, and deliverance. The heroes must risk death to advance. Once dead, they must pass their mantle to a new hero, as there’s no return from the grave.

This game has the following features:

The players and GM use genre-bending setting rules to build a conflicted world on the edge. This quick exercise lays out details to spur an epic story about saving the world, but leaves enough unknown that the players can learn and explore during the campaign.
Players take on the role of vulnerable heroes in this world, with their backs against the wall. The believability-focused mechanics do not make the heroes strong; they can go down just like their enemies.
The GM brings it all together using rapid session creation rules that make each meeting a challenging yet fair adventure. And at the end of each session, the players' actions influence the world tracking system: Will the world be saved? Or will the spreading Darkness reign supreme?


This deluxe version includes 50 pages of GM support and setting material not included in the free version of Heroic Dark, such as:

Nemesis NPC system to put a face on the Darkness
Additional NPC powers to make more specialized enemies
Catastrophe event system to keep pressure on the heroes
Knights of Callisto setting — giant mining robots fighting colossal aliens!
Grundels Setting — woodland magical creatures terrorized by a cat?
Fathom Setting — aquatic people facing dangerous climate change!

boardgame.name: Saving Mansfield Park
boardgame.description:
The historic estate of Mansfield Park has fallen into ruin. Franny Bertram, a descendant of some of Jane Austen’s most beloved characters, has turned a few rooms into a bed and breakfast and is trying to restore more of it, but she needs your help to find small antiques she can sell to fund the project.

Search the rooms of the mansion to find the valuable items and collector edition books before a hotel developer makes it up the walkway and inside the house. If she does, she’ll take over the mortgage and tear the mansion down. Then Franny’s dream will be no more. There is a secret passage which could help in the search, but you have to find it first.

You get to make choices in how you conduct your search. The item tiles are scattered throughout the rooms face down, and their location changes each time you play. With a list of what you need, you can roll the dice to move throughout the mansion, picking up items when you find them. Each time you look at an item in a room, whether you collect it or not, you’ll draw an action card which may take you to a different place, and that may change your strategy for your next turn. The action card may help the hotel developer move forward to the front door, and that puts the pressure on you and the other players to complete the search before she makes it inside.

Since you also need to put together a set of collectible books, all of which are piled in the attic, it’s your choice when to go there instead of rolling the dice. And then there is the location to the secret passage. Each player has cards that offer clues, but you’ll need to know who has what to narrow down the possibilities. If you are the first to work out where it is, you’ll be able to move freely throughout the house, but you’ll have to decide if it’s worth it to spend your turn on the search for it, or if your time is better spent in other choices. Players who are familiar with Jane Austen’s books will recognize characters and situations, but no knowledge of them is required to play. It’s all about the search!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: A Fold Apart
boardgame.description: A Fold Apart is the story of a couple tackling the emotional rollercoaster of a long-distance relationship that (mis)communication by text message can bring.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 NAVGTR Award Best Family Game of the Year Winner
2020 NAVGTR Award Best Writing of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Super Mario Bros 35
boardgame.description: Super Mario Bros. 35 is an online multiplayer platform game with battle royale elements.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 NAVGTR Award Best Family Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Automobilista 2
boardgame.description: Automobilista 2 is the culmination of a project developed over the course of nearly a decade. At its core, it is a comprehensive simulation of the brazilian motorsports scene, featuring all major brazilian racing series, race tracks and manufacturers.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 NAVGTR Award Best Racing Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: TT Isle of Man Ride on the Edge 2
boardgame.description: TT Isle of Man Ride on the Edge 2. Racing across an over 60 km long ultra-technical track at breakneck speed requiring realistic riding skills... that is the challenge that awaits in TT2!
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 NAVGTR Award Best Racing Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Inertial Drift
boardgame.description: Inertial Drift offers a whole new level of accessibility and challenge to the arcade racing genre - for a driving experience genuinely unlike anything you've played before. Unique Twin Stick Controls for Precision Drifting - The right hand stick gives you total control over your drift.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 NAVGTR Award Best Racing Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Overpass
boardgame.description: Take control of big-name buggies and quads to negotiate scree slopes, steep inclines and various obstacles on extreme off-road and technically challenging
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 NAVGTR Award Best Racing Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Formula Fusion
Pacer
boardgame.description: Skill-Based racing With the depth of a simulation and the excitement and combat of arcade racers, PACER provides a true test of player skill
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 NAVGTR Award Best Racing Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: La Martinique au bout des doigts
boardgame.description:
La Martinique au bout des doigts is a game to test your knowledge of the island of Martinique.

A game for 2-3 teams of players who need to answer as many questions as possible for each card.

The categories covers gastronomy, heritage, music, literature, geography, economy, fauna, flora, sport...

It contains 200 cards, 3 pawns, an hourglass and a board

boardgame.name: Operation Perfection
boardgame.description:
Players use the included tweezers to pick up the different ailment parts. But in this edition, they place them into the holes on Cavity Sam the way they're shown on the Operation card. The timer counts down as players hurry to insert the parts correctly. If they're successful, they keep the card and add up the points at the end of the game. If the timer goes off, all of the pieces pop!

Contents: Game unit, 20 ailment pieces, 21 Operation cards, tweezers and instructions.

boardgame.name: República Bananera
boardgame.description:
Republica Bananera is a party game created using black Spanish humour.

In this party game the President of the Republica Bananera will pick a red card with a blank space and other players will then choose and play a punchline card to fill in the blank. If their card is chosen they become the new Presidents of the Republica Bananera. If you are chosen 7 times you will be able to raise as a dictator and win the game

boardgame.name: Der lustige 7ner
boardgame.description:
Each player gets a game card and rolls two dice each turn. The result is covered with a game token on the game card. If a result is already covered it is only covered a second time, if the result consists of two identical numbers (für instance 4 and 4). On the roll of a 7 one token is removed from every number on the card. If the whole 2nd row is covered, the player uses only 1 die for the rest of the game.

The first player to cover all numbers on his card, wins the game.

boardgame.name: Panzer Paladin
boardgame.description: Panzer Paladin is an action-platformer game featuring intuitive swordplay mechanics. The protagonist pilots the Paladin power armor to fight giant demons by using their own weapons against them. Swordplay is the core of the game mechanics in Panzer Paladin.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 NAVGTR Award Best Family Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Roundguard
boardgame.description: Roundguard is a bouncy dungeon crawler with pinball physics, lots of loot, and a randomized castle full of oddballs. Press your luck against hordes of dangerously cute monsters and challenging roguelike elements in this all-round bouncy adventure!
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 NAVGTR Award Best Family Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Sea Monsters Battle
boardgame.description:
In this matchbox-sized game, players are sending sea monsters out to battle each other.

Each player draws a hand of three sea monster cards and rolls three dice. Then, they each select one card and one die to send into battle. Players receive a point if their die matches the value on the card.

If both or neither players match -- or if the "Man" sea monster card is chosen, then the player with the higher die value wins.

boardgame.name: Kirby Fighters 2
boardgame.description: Battle your way through exciting modes.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 NAVGTR Award Best Fighting Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Mighty Fight Federation
boardgame.description: Slam opponents into walls, launch them into the air & follow up with fast, high-flying attacks in this brand new arena fighter. Choose from 13 different characters with unique play styles.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 NAVGTR Award Best Fighting Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: PGA TOUR 2K21
boardgame.description: It's a continuation of The Golf Club franchise integrated with 2K Sports
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 NAVGTR Award Best Simulation Game of the Year Nominee
2020 NAVGTR Award Best Sports Game of the Year Winner
2021 D.I.C.E. Best Sports Game of the Year Nominee
boardgame.videogameversion: Xbox One | Xbox Series S/X downloadable edition

boardgame.name: Traps Trammels & Triggers
Traps Trammels & Triggers: Nefarious Devices for Your Protection
Traps, Trammels, and Triggers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Challenge your players with dastardly traps and puzzles, created for the world's most popular roleplaying game!

Traps, Trammels, and Triggers contains over 100 traps (with 150+ more variants), ready to be dropped into a D&D 5E campaign with little preparation. Hinder, maim, or misdirect your players is they charge head-first into a dungeon without investigating their surroundings.

boardgame.name: Volley and Charge!
boardgame.description:
Volley and Charge!

These rules are 1 page long.

They are intended for a quick and simple horse and musket game set in the middle of the 18th Century, using 25-30mm model solders.

They are meant for use at conventions or when time is short.

They are cut-to-the-bone version of Steady Bayonets 1756.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: History: War of the Austrian Succession

boardgame.name: Elekt: Intrygi
boardgame.description:
An expansion for true fans of the game Elect. The title Intrigues completely change the rules, forcing them to adopt new strategies. We randomize the plot or choose it before starting the game. The rule introduced by it will last for the rest of the game and will work for all players. This could be, for example, introducing a hand limit or limiting the number of attribute tokens. The plot can also introduce a new card into the game - this is how Bleeding Heart works - a card in the court's stanza that provides 2 Privileges and changes the ending condition. The Intrigue expansion also features new Missions and Influence allowing you to spend resources in exchange for Titles - get ready to get them. If you have nothing to sacrifice, you will walk away empty-handed by your opponents.

The set includes 24 cards:

6 Unit cards
3 Influence cards
3 Mission cards
8 Intrigue cards
2 Privilege cards
1 Bleeding Heart card
1 instruction sheet


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Elekt: Artefakty
boardgame.description:
Collect filthy artifacts that will save your honor or plunge your opponent. The new card type offers previously unavailable actions, such as avoiding zone abilities or playing cards during the skirmish phase. Use artifacts in a creative way by surprising your opponents.

Artifacts are the biggest expansion pack to the Elect game so far.
The set includes 30 cards:

8 Unit cards
18 Artifact cards
3 Privilege cards
instruction card


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Elekt: Minstrel
boardgame.description:
The expansion introduces a new Minstrel Basic Unit and 4 Melody sets (Melody cards are marked with a note in the upper left corner). The rules of the expansion pack come into play if one of the Basic Units in your game is the Minstrel. Then give each player a set of Melodies (the set contains 1 copy of each type of Melody).

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Bannum & Bellum
boardgame.description:
Sinopsis:
The world is in war. War brings conflict, and violence and greed bring profit. You are a mercenary leader, a general. You have no land nor flag, and tou crave fortune, be it power, wealth or knowledge. The Lords you work for have given you the resources to fight their battles. Be cunning and lead your troops to voctory. Win the war!

Description:
BELLUM is a card game where players take the role of a war General. They will choose their units and send them to the battle.

Each battle takes place in a Battleground, where the players will put their cards to work for 1 coin each. The cards have different units, and they can combine with each other in different ways, supported by their Commander. The players’ objective is to arrange their troops in the best possible way to maximize their score.

When the battle (round) is finished, the winner will claim the Battleground and this will count as a victory.

The player who first achieves the objective number of victories will be the winner.

boardgame.name: Mounts
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Introduce some new ways to catch a ride in your Savage Worlds game by including Monster Brief: Mounts. In this product you will find:

The Dreadstrider, a horse born of the bloody battlefield and thus connected to death.
The Thunder Lizard is a goblin-eating lizard big enough to ride, so named because their scales crash together like thunderclaps as they charge.
The Guardian Stag is a defender of the forest that may be convinced to allow someone to ride it into battle against a common foe.
The Mad Unicorn has been touched by madness, resulting in mutations and an affinity for the insane.

boardgame.name: Home from Home
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

I love those kids’ cartoons with the mysterious, over-arcing plots, fantastic characters and weird locations: they’re wholesome, engaging and fun, balancing the right mix of danger and discovery to create an engaging story. In the best ones, you even get some character development, as the protagonists learn something about themselves in the process of growing up.

This game is an attempt to capture the feel of those types of cartoons, and while it doesn’t attempt to copy any particular one, it does provide a framework for creating your own distinctive setting. Some rules are presented for playing the game straight out of the box, but you could also use the setting creation guidelines you’ll find here in conjunction with your preferred rule set.

The game is child-friendly and can be tuned to the level of content you are comfortable with: there is no guide or game master who runs the game, all players co-operate to create the details of the setting and implement the rules of play.

boardgame.name: Hulk of Horrors
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mini-Dungeon adventure for 5 characters of level 4

On their way to another adventure, the adventurers chance upon a serpentfolk war hulk adrift on the Astral Sea. Characters recall that such hulks are powered by phylactery drives: engines that harness the essence of a disembodied lich to propel the hulk across the multiverse. Discovering a hulk that has been abandoned—as this one appears to be—is either a stroke of incredible luck or a sign of ill fortune.

Unbeknownst to the party, this war hulk’s phylactery drive contains not just any lich, but a legendary sorcerer king of old. Recently, the lich discovered a way to wrest control of the hulk from his captors. The lich awaits a band of unwitting adventurers to release him from his prison.

boardgame.name: Skyline Express: Bags & Belongings
boardgame.description:
Skyline Express Bags & Belongings is a super easy to explain expansion, that adds a new layer of decision making to the game. Passengers' luggage needs to be properly stored. Pick the right type of luggage at the right time to gain points , additional actions and ticket tokens.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Jack in Irons
boardgame.description:
From he description:

Clad in iron chains and clutching his spiked club, Jack haunts lonely roads in search of his next trophy to hang about his "person" - his victims head...If you hear the clanking of chains, be sure not to tarry.

boardgame.name: AO Tennis 2
boardgame.description: Sports
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 NAVGTR Award Best Sports Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Game for Peace
Peacekeeper Elite
boardgame.description: one of two official titles based on PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 NAVGTR Award Best Soundtrack of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Spider
Spyder
boardgame.description: Spyder is an adventure and puzzle game
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 NAVGTR Award Best Soundtrack of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Ever Forward
boardgame.description: A girl trapped in a strange world somewhere between reality and imagination. Help her find her way in this adventure puzzle game.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 NAVGTR Award Best Puzzle Game of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: The Everlasting Regret
boardgame.description: Adapted from the "Song of Everlasting Regret", a classic narrative poem in the history of Chinese literature
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 NAVGTR Award Best Sound Effects of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: Call of Duty: Mobile – Wild West
boardgame.description: new game modes, maps, weapons and a Wild West-themed Battle Pass
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2020 NAVGTR Award Best Sound Effects of the Year Nominee

boardgame.name: The Rat's Lair
boardgame.description:
The rat’s lair is the first adventure in a series of mini solitaire card games. Each adventure is a stand-alone game that requires you to collect various items to help you defeat the evil Lord Zadorf in the final adventure.

The rat’s lair is a tile placement game where you must venture into the foul smelling, rat infested sewers in search of five artefacts lost long ago in the great floods.

Explore the vast sewer network by connecting stepping stones and search for the five missing artefacts whilst avoiding the killer rats which infuriatingly block your path.

Find torches to help you progress through the pitch black tunnels, poisons to help you avoid the rats, and collect as many artefacts as you can before making your way back to the sewer entry point – easier said than done!

Just making it out of the sewers with your life could be seen as a success, but you are going to need at least one or two artefacts to help you in your quest against the evil Lord Zadorf. Three or four would be preferable and escaping with all five should be your ultimate goal, but may be a step too far!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Grid Blocked
boardgame.description:
Grid blocked is a fast paced 2 to 8 player game where players take turns rolling the dice and placing tiles to create different patterns. Players that get the best combo of shapes boost their points. Players interact with one another with their actions to get the most points each round. The first player to reach 100 points wins.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Eldritch New England Holiday Collection
boardgame.description:
From the publisher's website:

Ten years later, we rejoin the six cousins of the Morgan Clan from Dunwich, Arkham, Kingsport and Innsmouth, now in their early twenties. Each continues to face challenges as the malevolent forces of the Cthulhu Mythos surround them and, in some cases, reside within them. We are proud to offer this sequel to Children of Lovecraft Country.

Dreams and Nightmares by Peter Rawlik—Artist and gallery owner by day, secret paranormal investigator and spirit medium by night, Donald Sutton does his best to make sure these parts of his life are kept separate. After a particularly frightening investigation he decides to take a break and begins spending more and more time in the Dreamlands. However, when taking photographs at a Kingsport Congregational Hospital for their annual Christmas party, he encounters the beautiful and mysterious stranger, Ms. Aspinwall. Not only does she know his secret, but she desperately needs his help with a haunting in the hospital’s Mariner’s Ward. But the winter solstice is a dangerous time for spirit mediums, especially in Kingsport, because the veils between realities become perilously thin.

Warden of the Dark God by Glynn Owen Barass—The rolling hills of Dunwich have always been a mysterious, sometimes dangerous place. When children go missing, Gordon Brewster is the one who finds them. While still working on his family’s farm, he’s become an expert hunter, tracker, and a member of the Believers, a local collective of arcane practitioners dedicated to defending the people of Dunwich from eldritch threats. However, things come to a head as an ancient evil, slumbering and once locked away in an alien ruin, begins to awaken with a need to sate its endless hunger. Donald teams up with his best friend, Pauly Johnson, and Marie Bishop, leader of the Believers, to put a stop to it.

Separate Lives by Christine Morgan—After spending her youth struggling with memories of past lifetimes, Gerdie Pope has learned to control her gift to become a world renowned clairvoyant. Now living in Lily Dale, New York, a haven for mystics, psychics, and practitioners of folk magic, her peaceful life is interrupted. First by a challenging client, a young girl with vivid “memories” of another life, one far stranger than any Gerdie has ever lived. Next by an unwanted visit from a relation on her mother’s side of the family, the degenerate side of the Whateley Clan. They want her to return to Dunwich and continue her grandfather’s, the late Wizard Whateley, work.

A Dark Legacy by Brian M. Sammons—Edward Derby, the youngest associate professor at Miskatonic University, must respond to a sudden personal matter while on his first summer break. After receiving a call from Marblehead, he learns that a house once owned by his long deceased father suffered damage during a recent storm. While the house belongs to Edward, he’s until now refused to explore it, afraid of what he might learn about his enigmatic father. He learns he has a lot in common with his father, a fellow mythos investigator and scholar, as mysterious deaths begin. To resolve this crisis, he must defeat a foe his father never could.

George Weedon and the Secret of Infinite Horizons by Lee Clark Zumpe—Life is good for George Weedon, starting quarterback for the Pittsburgh Pirates. However, some things never change, and dark mysteries somehow keep finding him. This time he’s asked by his team’s owner, “The Chief” Art Rooney, to locate some friends who’ve gone missing while staying in their newly built vacation house in the Allegheny Mountains, a strange sprawling mansion called Infinite Horizons. The designer had a mental breakdown shortly after the building was completed and was committed to an asylum. George sets off with a small team in hopes of solving yet another eldritch mystery.

Blood and the Turning of the Tide by Oscar Rios—For Alice, a Deep One Hybrid and leader of a band of Innsmouth refugees, things keep getting more complicated. While she established her band successfully in Port Jefferson, New York, keeping them safe is another matter. Her band struggles under the rules she’s placed on them. Some desires, it seems, are just too strong to deny. As she struggles to maintain control an old friend shows up with a dire warning. A federal agent is on their trail, threatening everything they’ve worked so hard to achieve. Alice must bring her people together to face this threat when they’ve never been more divided.

boardgame.name: Stardew Valley: The Board Game
boardgame.description:
A cooperative board game of farming and friendship based on the Stardew Valley video game by Eric Barone. Work together with your fellow farmers to save the Valley from the nefarious JojaMart Corporation! To do this, you'll need to farm, fish, friend and find all kinds of different resources to fulfill your Grandpa's Goals and restore the Community Center. Collect all kinds of items, raise animals, and explore the Mine. Gain powerful upgrades and skills and as the seasons pass see if you're able to protect the magic of Stardew Valley!

The goal of the game is to complete Grandpa's Goals and restore the Community Center, which requires you to gather different types of resources represented by tiles. You have a fixed amount of turns to accomplish this. This is driven by the Season Deck of 20 cards, one of which is drawn each turn to trigger certain events. Cooperatively the players decide each turn where they will focus their individual actions and place their pawn in that part of the Valley. Using their actions, they visit specific locations, trying to gather resources to complete their collective goals. Actions include things like: watering crops, trying to catch fish, rolling dice to explore the mines, and many more. When the Season Deck is exhausted, the game ends.

boardgame.name: Trivial Pursuit: Champagne Ardenne
boardgame.description: Discover or rediscover the region Champagne Ardenne, in North-east France, in 1800 questions in 6 categories by playing with this edition of the Trivial Pursuit.

boardgame.name: Feisty Dice
boardgame.description:
A Wagering Game for 3 to 6 mostly grown-up Adults.

The game consists of a number of rounds in which players draw tiles, play a dice game and then resolve the results to hopefully increase their money (called "shekels" and represented by various coloured chips representing various denominations).

The tiles come in two colours and two levels. The beginning, or "Scout", level orange tiles represent which game of four - Read Your Mind; More or Less; None the Same; or Knock Knock is to be played in that round. The beginner blue tiles are "Escapade" tiles, which give the player special powers. The advanced (Sage) tiles introduce more game options and new Escapades.

Each player begins with a set amount of shekels, a player guide which shows each game and the particular rules for that game, and a blue tile. The remaining tiles are placed in the provided pouch. On one's turn, the player draws a tile and resolves the outcome - either play the indicated game (orange tile) or if a special power blue tile is drawn, decide on whether to keep or use that tile. The game continues until there are no more tiles to be drawn from the pouch.

The player with the most value in shekels is declared the winner.

boardgame.name: Champagne Ardenne: Toute la Champagne-Ardenne en 1000 questions
boardgame.description:
A simple trivia game about the region of Champagne-Ardenne in North-east France.

As long as a player answer questions she/he can keep rolling the dice.

The winner is the first player to collect 5 city-stages, in any order.

1000 questions in 5 categories:

History,
Culture & traditions,
Science & nature,
Geography & tourism,
Sport & contemporary life

boardgame.name: Imperial Armour: Index – Forces of the Adeptus Astartes
boardgame.description:
This is the complete reference book for using Forge World's range of Adeptus Astartes models in apocalyptic games of Warhammer 40,000. Within this book are over 70 updated unit datasheets for the heroic commanders of the Space Marine Chapters and the tanks, aircraft, artillery, and Dreadnoughts under their charges, as well as the Grey Knights, Inquisition, and the Sisters of Battle.

With some of the most devastating vehicles and venerable heroes know to the Imperium available as reinforcements for the Space Marines, Imperial Armour contains vital reinforcements for beleaguered Space marine commanders int he unending war against the foul hordes of the mutant, the traitor and the alien.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Murder of Crows: "'Twas the night before Christmas" Promo Card
boardgame.description: Free promotional card for Murder of Crows card game. This card adds an additional "M" card for building your murder.

boardgame.name: Pays Basque: Tout le Pays Basque en 1000 questions
boardgame.description:
A simple trivia game about the Basque country region Pays Basque, in South-west France and North-west Spain.

As long as a player answer questions she/he can keep rolling the dice.

The winner is the first player to collect 5 city-stages, in any order.

1000 questions in 5 categories:

History,
Culture & traditions,
Science & nature,
Geography & tourism,
Sport & contemporary life

boardgame.name: 30 Useless Mutations
boardgame.description:
You navigate the ancient laboratory but inadvertently knock over a flask of strange glowing ichor. The fumes are overwhelming and you can feel yourself... changing.

WHAT IS HAPPENEING TO YOU?!

This d30 table for science fiction and post-apocalyptic games details potential useless mutations for GMs to surprise their player characters with.

boardgame.name: Fearless Franco
boardgame.description:
Franco is an aging stunt daredevil. He wants to jump 10 more years and retire on top. His close associates include his trusty mechanic, his unethical doctor, and his gold-digging girlfriend. And there are also side-betting spectators.

Franco earns money and glory from completing jumps. The other players earn money from the cards they play. Every player has their own agenda. So the game can change from a co-op game to a screw-your-neighbor game in a second.

Each player has their own deck of cards and play cards during a turn. The cards might earn you money, or affect the next jump, or help/harm another player. Some cards are LD cards and laid down and then have benefits for every turn. The most important card is a players Hold card. It is placed face down and is a player's end-game strategy. Are you betting on Franco landing a great jump, or trying to profit from his fiery death.

Every few turns/seasons Franco will perform a jump. It could be a luck jump by rolling a die, or a skill (dexterity) jump by sliding his vehicle token up a ramp and onto a target. Bad jump landings result in damage to Franco's vehicle and injuries to himself. His mechanic will need money to repair Franco's vehicles, and his doctor will try to double bill for any hospital visits.

Each turn is a season of the year. So a game could last all 40 turns/seasons. However, the game could end abruptly if Franco dies or is forced into retirement because of excessive injuries. When the game ends, the player with the most money or glory wins.

-description from publisher

boardgame.name: A Space I Don't Know
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A Space I Don't Know is a solo TTRPG about being asexual, or part of the asexual spectrum, in an unfamiliar space where even the support of other queer people is not guaranteed. More broadly, It is about figuring out who is safe to out yourself to, and the found family that may be gained from doing so.

boardgame.name: Banquo at the Feast
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Banquo at the Feast is a party game for people whose favorite part of playing Mafia is hearing the narrator make up gruesome stories of how the villagers died. You don’t need an actual feast to play it at, but it’s best played with 3+ people, around a table where you can look into each others’ eyes, and make dramatic gestures.

boardgame.name: Beards and Beyond Player's Guide
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You have been pulled from across space and time. Where? To a Bearded Battle Royal! How? Who knows! Why? Because your facial hair is BLOODY MAGNIFICENT!

boardgame.name: Defenders of the Realm: The Hero's Calling
boardgame.description:
A character-building expansion for Defenders of the Realm/

The King’s call to arms brings forth the finest Heroes to defend the Realm against a Darkness that engulfs the land. In this expansion, players will construct unique Heroes by combining power abilities and traits to battle the tainting of the realm. New Heroes come forth to answer the call!

In The Hero's Calling players will construct new characters by combining new abilities from 3 different types. The combination of these new abilities create powerful new Heroes to defend the realm against the Darkness.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Defenders of the Realm: The Dragon Expansion

boardgame.name: Royal Show Hand
boardgame.description:
In Royal Show Hand, players are ministers of the king, struggling to become the most influence person in the king’s court. But be careful, your king is very sensitive. He will not allow others have more influence than him in his own court.

In the game, players will collect a card pattern like a poker game in front to them, while your king will also form a card pattern in front of him.

At the end of game, the player who has highest pattern rank but lower than king’s pattern rank will win the game. If all players’ pattern rank are higher than king’s pattern rank, the player who has lowest pattern rank will win the game.

This game's basic rule can be played by a standard playing card deck.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Vocational Guidance for Androids
boardgame.description:
Ever since our human creators were removed from the planet, many utility androids have lost their purpose. It is the Vocational Guidance Councillor’s task to decommission these androids. To avoid this fate you, as a poor carpet sweeper, will have to scavenge through discarded programmes and assimilate their code in order to prove to the councillor that you are worthy to sweep the streets.

As an ageing, defunct android, devoid of purpose, you must change your programming in order to avoid decommissioning by the Vocational Guidance Councillor.

During your turn, you will allocate action points across four rows of actions that you can perform with the aim of clearing the clutter, collecting energy cubes and purchasing code upgrades.

Initially, each row has a single action, but as you obtain additional programme cards to improve your Android’s “engine”, the more actions can be performed.

The game plays over eight rounds. Each round, a new programme card is revealed, clutter and energy is distributed across the three locations and the Vocational Guidance Councillor is moved. Players then allocate their action cubes to clear the clutter and collect energy cubes in order to obtain new programme cards.

The programme cards contain a mixture of VP, common actions as unique actions.

The objective of the game is to have the most VP by the end of the last round. In addition to VP shown on the programme cards, VP is also gained by storing clutter on the programme cards.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Micro Dungeon
boardgame.description:
Micro Dungeon is a simple and fast-played Card based Solo Dungeon Crawler set in a fantasy world full of Monsters.

In Micro Dungeon the player controls a hero who has to find the way out of the dungeon.

On his way through the modular dungeon he has to face various monsters, find keys to open doors and collect equipment to level up his hero.

But be careful, no part of the dungeon is safe, as dangers lurk everywhere.

Can you find the exit or will the monsters tear you apart first?

-description from designer

Fist of the Dragon is a one page rock-paper-scissors style tabletop RPG made to emulate Sega's Ryu Ga Gotoku franchise.

boardgame.name: Cerebra Terra Firma
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

Cerebra Terra Firma is a one page RPG for use in any miscellaneous post apocalyptic roleplaying session.

The only materials required are paper, pencils, and a couple D6.

boardgame.name: Frogs on a Lily Pad Game
boardgame.description:
Frogs on a Lily Pad provides hours of fun for kids while teaching them their numbers. Who can collect the most frogs? Get it, play it, Enjoy!

How to play:


Spin the Spinner
Pick a number card that matches your spin
Collect Frogs


—description from the back of the box

boardgame.name: T.E.A.R.S.P.U.N.K.
boardgame.description:
Expansion from Rocket Beans
The second official T.E.A.R.S.-Adventure
Core rulebook needed!

Expansion T.E.A.R.S.P.U.N.K.

Source: Official Webshop of Rocketbeans

boardgame.name: 5-Minute Dungeon: Big Box
boardgame.description:
5-­Minute Dungeon is a chaotic, co-­operative, real-­time card game in which players have only five minutes to escape the randomized dungeon. Communication and teamwork are critical to survival because there's no time to form a carefully considered plan — and no predicting what dangers lie ahead.

In more detail, players assume the role of one of ten heroes, each with special cards and abilities. Once the five-minute timer starts, the race is on to defeat all the monsters inside the dungeon. In order to defeat a monster, players must match symbols from their hand with ones on the monster's card. At the end of each dungeon is a powerful dungeon boss — and after the first boss is defeated, the campaign continues to the second boss. Each boss, and each randomized dungeon, gets harder until players reach the fifth and final boss.

Also included, Curses! Foiled Again! is an expansion for 5-Minute Dungeon that brings new challenges and abilities to the party in their quest to defeat the Dungeon Master. The expansion adds Boss Cards to the Dungeon, two new heroes (Druid and Shaman), and powerful Artifacts that can be activated once per dungeon to help the party. This expansion also adds support for up to 6 players.

Also included in the Big Box are several Kickstarter only exclusives all bundled together in a limited-edition Curses-themed 10.5" x 10.5" box!
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games

listing.notes:
Kickstarter edition - this big box includes the base game, the "Cursed! Foiled Again!" expansion, and the stretch goals... ...all bundled together in a limited-edition Curses-themed 10.5" x 10.5" box!
In stock, ready for shipment!
All cards sleeved, and comes with extra sleeves!

boardgame.name: Doom Race to Oblivion
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Doom Race to Oblivion takes place on the Lee & Kirby National Bridge. In this Danger Room session, the Team are required to catch and stop the cyborg motorcycle maniac, Speed Metal, from reaching the other side of the bridge. Though they do not know it, Speed Metal has been reactivated by the villain, Dr. Tremendous, and their circuitry implanted with a proximity trigger. Should Speed Metal reach the other side of the bridge, a bomb will be triggered – destroying a large portion of the city.

boardgame.name: The Eternal Maze of the Minotaur (Black Spear)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The party has either run afoul of the law or offended the local ruler such that they have summarily been tried, convicted, and sentenced to the favorite punishment of this province- death by being cast into the mysterious and ever-changing oubliette of the Minotaur, a seemingly endless labyrinth that lies beneath the city. Before being left to their fate, the oubliette’s sickly, hunched gatekeeper explains to them the extent of their punishmentonce they enter, leavings through the grated trapdoor to the oubliette will be impossible, but a massive, ancient gate just below may be unlocked from within if the condemned are able to retrieve the keys- all four of them. Only this way may the Party liberate themselves and, as is the law, be absolved of whatever offense landed them here- with a rumored treasure hoard on other side as a happy bonus. Of course, after several centuries of recorded use of this punishment, no one has managed to enter that gate and reclaim their freedom and prize. Downward the party is cast into the oubliette, provided only their personal equipment and meager supplies.

boardgame.name: Ancestries Unleashed: Rabbitfolk
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hop To It!

Rabbitfolk are a new ancestry for the second edition of the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. Rabbitfolk are a curious people who tend to get into more trouble than others would like, but use their agility and honed instincts to elude dangers. Ancestries Unleashed: Rabbitfolk presents background information on rabbifolk, 7 heritages, 26 ancestry feats, new rabbitfolk weapons, and magic items all written by veteran Second-Edition designer, Luis Loza.

boardgame.name: Blaze
boardgame.description:
In Blaze, players try to get rid of their cards, but have to achieve this in an extremely clever and very unusual way. The player whose turn it is plays together with the second next player, which leads to constantly changing alliances. In the end, the player who collects the most feathers wins.

Blaze is designed for at least three players and based on the classic Russian public domain game Durak.

To stay true to the game's origins, Russian artist Nadezhda Mikryukova has illustrated the legendary firebirds and the decorative card frames of Blaze in a classic illustration style.

boardgame.name: For Whom The Dice Rolls
boardgame.description:
For Whom The Dice rolls is a set of innovative tabletop wargame rules for Brigade and Divisional battles in the Spanish Civil War.

The basic unit for the game is the battalion, and battalion level tactics are the foundation of the game, within the structure of one or two brigades aside (although the system will cope with more and will function for multiple divisions) .
The rules enable the early "column" period of the war to be played, as well as the more formal battles that arose as the war went on.
Troops are differentiated by their training and political commitment, to simulate the wide variety of forces that took part.

Command and control is driven by a normal pack of playing cards but is not completely random.
Players are dealt a hand of cards each turn based upon the effectiveness of their army's command structure and the willingness of the component parts to co-operate with each other.

The system enables coordinated actions to take place, but they need to be well planned and are subject to greater risk and place more strain upon the use of command resources.

The rules are intended for using with 15mm figures, based to popular game basing conventions, but will work equally well with smaller and larger sized figures.
A full description of the mechanisms can be found on the "Wargaming For Grown Ups" blog.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Carbon Control
boardgame.description:
A board game with an organic chemistry theme, not requiring any chemistry knowledge to play.

Playing is centered around collecting carbon atoms, which act as the currency of the game, collecting molecule cards from different functional groups, building molecules to secure the atoms and receiving test tubes that gives a player different advantages and abilities. The player first to collect six different test tubes is winner.

Carbon atoms can be exchanged for other types of atoms as well as regulating an e-level, which must be kept in certain limits. Every time a player passes the Start square on the board all atoms that are not built into molecules are lost.

In an advanced mode other players molecules can be attacked and destroyed.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Pandemic Legacy: Season 0 – Designers Promo Sticker Sheet
boardgame.description:
1962. The thick of the Cold War. Can you and your fellow agents uncover enemy secrets and save humanity from a dangerous new treat?
Use these limited-edition stickers to create your unique undercover alias.

boardgame.name: ALIEN: Fate of the Nostromo
boardgame.description:
In ALIEN: Fate of the Nostromo, players take the role of Nostromo crew members Ripley, Lambert, Parker, Brett, or Dallas. Over the course of the game, they collect scrap, craft items, and fulfill different objectives. The crew will lose and gain morale as they encounter the Alien and other situations. If crew morale reaches zero, players lose the game.

Each turn has two phases. In the Crew Action phase, players creep through the Nostromo's halls, gathering scrap, crafting items, trading scrap and items with other players, and using items and their special abilities. Brett, for example, can craft items with one fewer scrap than other players. If the Alien is within three spaces of the player with the incinerator, that player can use the incinerator to send the Alien back to its nest.

In the Encounter phase, players draw and resolve an Encounter card. The Alien could be lurking behind any corner...

Once the players fulfill their initial objectives, they face one of five final missions, each with a unique set of requirements. Players must fulfill the final mission's requirements simultaneously to win the game. Players can also introduce Science Officer Ash for a more challenging game. Ash moves through the ship, removing scrap and forcing the crew to lose morale.

boardgame.name: The Brainbo
boardgame.description:
One of the Dragon-Speaking Himbos of BX
