Less beefy than their Gymbo friends, the Brainbo is every really cute adventuring party's adorable, heart-warming (but overly trusting) brainiac. Like all Himbos of BX, Brainbos are not restricted to any one gender.

boardgame.name: The Dreambo
boardgame.description:
One of the Reaction Rolling Himbos of BX

User summary:

The runaway scion, the aspiring bandit ruler, or the charming bard, any or all of them could be the Dreambo, a complete part of any really cute adventuring party. Like all Himbos of BX, Dreambos are not restricted to any one gender.

boardgame.name: The Gymbo
boardgame.description:
One of Dungeoneering Himbos of BX

User summary:

Whether their allies call them himbos, herbos, bruhs, or "pal"-adins, these cheerful deadlifting sweethearts are often the hearts and souls of any really cute OSR party. Like all Himbos of BX, Gymbos are not restricted to any one gender.

boardgame.name: Rambazamba
boardgame.description:
What a din! The worms wriggle contentedly in the puddles,
completely oblivious to the chickens, who really aren’t their friends ...
Meanwhile, the foxes chase the chickens — making the dogs bark and the chickens squawk!

AIM OF THE GAME
The first player to collect five cards of one species (e.g., five worms) on the table in front of them wins.

HOW TO PLAY
The youngest player decides whether they want to start or will allow the oldest player to go first.
Play then continues in a clockwise direction. When it is your turn, play either one single card or a pair (i.e., the male and female of one species).
Take as many cards from the draw pile as you need to have three cards in your hand again.
Choose one of the three cards in your hand, then place it either in your farm or in a neighbor’s farm.
Depending on the card you play, the following happens:
If you put a chicken in a farm, the farm’s owner must immediately remove two worms from their farm.
If you put a fox in a farm, the farm’s owner must immediately remove two chickens from their farm.
If you put a dog in a farm, the farm’s owner must immediately remove two foxes from their farm.
Haystacks protect the animal cards that are beneath them in the animal line.
Use the pitchfork to remove one top card of your choice from an animal line in a neighbor’s farm. You may also use the pitchfork to remove a haystack.
Always play the farmer card by placing it on the discard pile. Each player — yourself included — must place up to two unprotected dogs (if available) from their farm on the discard pile.

boardgame.name: Carta SRD
boardgame.description:
A Game-Making Toolkit

From the introduction:

Carta SRD is built for making games about exploration. The idea is that players lay cards out in a grid , and then turn them over one at a time, exploring prompts and mechanics as they do. The game is a sort of boardgame / storygame hybrid, where players explore journaling prompts by physically moving their marker from card to card and looking up the results. It can have a definite goal, making it more boardgame-like, or it can be more nebulous and story-focused.

boardgame.name: Chorelock
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

A 2 player game about making demons do your work.

boardgame.name: The Dark Sentencer
boardgame.description:
a record collection 2k19 game

From the introduction:

YOU are a prisoner on the DARK SENTENCER, a high tech prison planet for the worst of the worst. In ELEVEN DAYS, you and the allies you’ve made during your time here are going to ESCAPE.

Unfortunately, you still have to finalize your plan, and eleven days is just enough time for everything to go completely off the rails.

boardgame.name: Necromunda: Underhive – Ancient Vox Box Tactics Card
boardgame.description:
Promo found in White Dwarf issue 458 from November 2020.
Play this card when activating a fighter.
When this card is played, decide how many times the activating fighter will turn the crank (1 to 3 times). roll that many D6, add the results together and check the effect.

boardgame.name: Achtung! Cthulhu 2d20 Quickstart
Achtung! Cthulhu Quickstart Rules and Adventure!
A Quick Trip to France
Szybki wypad do Francji Broszura Startowa
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dare you face the terror lurking at the heart of Saint Sulac? Join a band of intrepid Allied agents as they investigate the mystery gripping this obscure corner of France. Who are the mysterious Nazi Black Sun? Why have they overrun this sleepy French village? What are they doing with the villagers they imprison in the mysterious ancient chateau at its centre?

This FREE 48 Page Quickstart PDF contains:

Complete starter rule set for Achtung! Cthulhu 2d20 with plenty of hints and tips for new GMs.
An exciting adventure A Quick Trip to France to begin your journey into The Secret War!
Five pre-generated characters so you can pick up and play the game straight away.
Battle the forces of the Nazi Occult and save mankind from the malign power of the Mythos!

boardgame.name: Empty Orchestra (Remastered)
boardgame.description:
A free-form LARP of Karaoke and Revolution

From the introduction:

It is a time of turmoil.

The Opposition tightens its ever present grip on society.

Music in all of its forms is outlawed.

The time has come for action. You are the few, the first to stand up and say ‘no more’.

You know The Opposition is strong, and you stand alone. But if you succeed tonight, you won’t be alone for long.

Tomorrow, there will be more of you. Standing together. Defiant. United. Strong. This is your chance.

Rise up. Take the stage.

Save the world.

boardgame.name: Adeptus Titanicus: The Horus Heresy – Venerable Machine Spirit Stratagem Promo Card
boardgame.description: This promo card was included in the November 2020 issue of White Dwarf Magazine along with promos for 4 other games. It is a "Tricks and Tactics" Stratagem card.
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Game: Adeptus Titanicus – The Horus Heresy (Games Workshop)
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Adeptus Titanicus: The Horus Heresy Rules Set

boardgame.name: DANGER DAYS
boardgame.description:
from the itch.io page:
the world has ended for all intents and purposes, and KILLJOYS like you are the only people left, save the mindless droves of people sedated into compliance by a war-mongering, resource-guzzling MEGACORP. you live on the FRINGES, far away from the big cities where society resides — deserts, abandoned suburbs, wastelands, etc. but around every corner are EXTERMINATORS, mercenaries hired by the megacorp to bring people like you in — or take you down.

DANGER DAYS is a fast-paced, high-stakes, post-apocalyptic game about big feelings, for 2+ players, a deck of cards, and some loud music.

inspired by DANGER DAYS: THE TRUE LIVES OF THE FABULOUS KILLJOYS by My Chemical Romance

boardgame.name: Death of a Hero
boardgame.description:
from the itch.io page:
DEATH OF A HERO is a conversational role-playing game about a group of adventurers grieving a fallen party member after they heroically sacrificed themselves to defeat the Villain.

Throughout the game you will take turns developing and discussing the story of the Hero, from when the party was first formed to the Hero's death. By this act of remembrance, you will deal with hidden emotions held for yourself and the Hero as you slowly come to terms with their death.

boardgame.name: Fallen Through the Hourglass
boardgame.description:
System Reference Document

From the introduction:

This document is aimed at designers looking to make games with similar mechanics to the tabletop roleplaying game Cage of Sand.

boardgame.name: Destined
boardgame.description:
from the itch.io page:
Destined is a 5 page luxury tabletop experience designed to be played by groups between 3-5 people. It is a game about legacy, community, and the stories they will tell about us when we die.

from the introduction:
Destined is a game about legacy. To play, you will need a pencil, some friends, and some six sided dice. You’ll also need some paper to write down the details of your character and their community.
In Destined, you take on the role of a warrior mage, greatest among your people, and you embark on a quest that will inevitably consume you to empower your people and leave your mark upon the world.

boardgame.name: [Escape!] The Quick Start Guide
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

It was supposed to be a regular vacation - fun in the sun with friends, the love of your life, or alone - when things went terribly wrong. Now you’ve awoken in a dark room with no recollection of how you arrived there, or even if you’re the only one in the building - wherever you are, you don’t feel safe, and you know you have to escape before it’s too late.

boardgame.name: Kampen om Karlskrona
boardgame.description:
Kampen om Karlskrona is a game about the Swedish city of Karlskrona. The mechanics is, roughly, a mix of Monopoly and Trivial Pursuit where most of the questions are about the city and it´s history.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Escape
boardgame.description:
Can You Get Off the Island?

From the game:

The field of Origology - the study of Origins, Magic, and Lineages - has made leaps and bounds in the three decades I have been alive. Although the search for the beginning of magic is still ongoing, I had the pleasure to be a part of Professor Ng’ s test group that helped to irrevocably prove the existence of Base Origins, the most basic components of our magic. Water, Fire, Air, Earth, and Spirit - every origin that ever is, was, or will be can be categorized in one of these five basic principles.

boardgame.name: The Compass Rose System Reference Document
boardgame.description:
From the game:

The Rose System is built to be played with at least 4 twelve-sdied dice (4d12) and one or more decks of Playing or Tarot cards. Games can be built to play solo or with friends.

boardgame.name: The Gilded City
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

The Gilded City, the hub of humanity, the moloch and last respite in the center of the Void. You are heavily indebted to cruel entities and must venture out into the darkness to obtain treasures or die trying.

User summary:

The game is published as a series of JPG images, intended to be used for printing card-sized rules.

boardgame.name: Escape from Skullcano Island
boardgame.description:
(publisher blurb)

Ominous signs have been sweeping across the land. Forbidding skies stained the color of blood. Thunderous, bestial sounds roaring from across the sea. Natural disasters of all varieties are raging uncontrollably across the land. Through it all, rumors swirl of strangely-clad heretics and wild-eyed blasphemers running amok, whispering prophecies of annihilation. What is happening… and why?

Learned folk of every race have assembled with the most renowned oracles and seers of our age in an effort to discover what is truly happening. They all point to one place as the source of their collective woe – the primeval jungles and untouched shores of the legendary Skullcano Island!

Through eldritch sorcery and divine visions, these great users of magic have deduced that a terrible power has arrived on Skullcano Island, drawn to the light and life that is our world. These mysterious wardens of doom seek to perpetuate an apocalyptic extinction event that will plunge the world back into a primordial age, using the island's legendary kaiju to wipe the slate clean once and for all.

Now that the land is filled with these terrible tidings of the apocalypse and all signs point to Skullcano Island, a call has gone out for only the most experienced and powerful of adventurers. An elite fellowship has been assembled and sent forth to discover what the true heart of this menace is and, if able, put a stop to it before the entire world is reduced to ashes. Will the player characters survive and – if so – what will remain of the world when they are done?

boardgame.name: Adventures & Interludes
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Can you hear the call of adventure?

Adventures & Interludes is a compilation of eight adventures for use with The Hero's Journey: Second Edition. Whether you're trying to break The Curse of Cormac's Hollow, save a clan of stalwart dwarves from strange Goblin Promises, or facing the dreaded Midnight Rider of Loch Dearmad, this supplement provides endless hours of play, as well as new creatures, heirlooms, and aspects for use in any legendarium.

boardgame.name: Ex nihilo
boardgame.description:
Ex nihilo is a highly tactical and quite novel stack-fighting game with an emergent checkmate-esque win condition. The novelty of this game lies in its central gimmick: Every move consists in moving a stack. In this sense it is a pure movement game. Yet, the game features both placement and captures.

Rules:
The game is for 2 players and is played with stackable pieces of two colors on a hexagonal arrangement of hexagons (a hexhex board). The board starts out empty. The game is over as soon as one player is unable to make a move. The other player is then the winner.

Movement – overview:
Stacks move along straight open lines and grow when they move away from the center cell. This game is unusual in allowing movement of stacks containing 0 pieces. It is by growing these that pieces get onto the board in the first place.

Movement – details:
On your turn, you must move a stack not topped by an enemy piece to an empty cell reachable through an unbroken line of empty cells. By convention, a single piece is considered a stack of size 1 and an empty cell is considered to contain a stack of size 0.

If, after you have moved a stack, it is farther away from the center cell than before it was moved (measured in number of steps), its size is increased by 1 per step further away from the center it now is. This is effected by adding pieces to the top of it from your hand.

You may move a proper part of a stack by splitting it. That is, if a stack contains several pieces you can choose to only move the top n pieces, given that you do not change their order, for any number n less than the number of pieces in the stack.

You may also move a whole stack, but only on the condition that you move it farther away from the center cell. A consequence is that moving a whole stack always results in its size increasing. Together with the convention that empty cells contain stacks of size 0, this also has the consequence that you can effectively place a new stack on the board by moving a stack of size 0.

Note that nothing special happens to the cell you moved the 0-stack from – it still contains a 0-stack.

Capturing – overview:
Flanked enemy stacks are captured by being taken hostage for a move. Capturing is obligatory: If a capturing move is available, a capturing move must be made. The winner will be the player who manages to force their opponent to capture an immovable stack.

Capturing – details:
If (and only if) the top piece of a stack is of your color, it is said to partake in flanking an enemy stack if (i) this enemy stack is exactly in the middle of a line of otherwise empty cells going from the flanking stack to another one of your stacks, and (ii) all three of these stacks are of the same size.

If, after you have moved a stack, it partakes in flanking one or more enemy stacks, you must immediately move one of these enemy stacks. Except for the obvious difference that you are moving an enemy stack, all normal rules apply to this move. For example: If the captured stack grows (if you move it farther away from the center cell, that is), it grows by the addition of pieces of your color, so situations where this hostage move must itself be a capturing move are possible. Such chaining of captures must continue until you capture a stack that is not in a position to continue the chain. Growing captured stacks is the only way to take ownership of them more permanently.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Dying Hard on Hardlight Station
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dying Hard on Hardlight Station is a new module for the Mothership Sci-Fi Horror RPG. It’s both an open-ended adventure and plug-and-play setting; envisioned as a cyberpunk Xmas mashup of Die Hard and Alien Resurrection. In the adventure, your team of grizzled PCs will be torn between saving friends locked in the Medtech facility or crawling to freedom in the vents of the corporate-controlled Hardlight Station; all while avoiding capture by the brutal Blackshield Mercenary Company. Unbeknownst to all, however, Blackshield’s invasion has caused the containment protocols at the Healthtek facility to malfunction. Now, in the bowels of the station, something horrible has awoken, and, after a long, torturous sleep, they hunger to feed.

Dying Hard on Hardlight Station takes inspiration from two of the greatest sci-fi horror and action franchises of all time and jams them into a compact, highly gameable surface for your enjoyment. Every page of the station is packed with efficient, evocative details big on imagination and light on overlong prose to make the book as table-ready as possible.

Tons of sci-fi mayhem and haunting horrors await in the pages of Dying Hard on Hardlight Station, including:

Three or more fully mapped station locations - Loaded with loot tables, adventure hooks, custom encounters, and interesting NPCs.
Three Original Factions - The Blackshield Mercenary Company, Station Administration Nakatomi Solutions Inc, and the ravening Alien Hybrids. Each vying to come out on top in the battle for the station.
The Hardlight Station Directory - a guidebook filled with shops, entertainments, NPCs and jobs for your crew... should anyone survive the initial adventure.

boardgame.name: Desert Moon of Karth
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Desert Moon of Karth is a space western sandbox adventure zine for the Mothership Sci-Fi Horror RPG.

Karth is a tiny mesa studded moon on the galaxy's edge. The only way down is an antique space elevator to the lawless boomtown of Larstown; a place surrounded by even greater danger and strangeness in the wastes beyond. Survival or salvation is not guaranteed, partner.

Harvest ossified coral corpses to live forever. Become an involuntary organ donor. Dodge ancient orbital defenses. Explore sand blown ruins. Hunt the fearsome sandsquid. Ride camels through the dunes. Drink whisky until you’ve forgotten your own name.

Desert Moon of Karth is a meaty 52 pages, chock full of evocative illustrations and also includes:

10 detailed and dangerous locations to explore including a ship graveyard, camel ranch, organic coral caves, and a decadent shattered spire.
Regional Moon Map and rules for point crawling navigation.
Detailed colonial Larstown map, rumors, NPC’s, prospective jobs, and fine establishments.
5 volatile factions for players to interact with including marooned pirates, immortal organ harvesters, tribal park rangers, extinct coral beings, and a colonial boomtown of prospectors.
Evolving encounters based on the day/night cycle (and it’s sometimes night for a week).
Tons of 1d10 tables ranging from creepy prayers, to strange technology, to requested organs, to random drugs.
Rules for sandsquid hunting and a dungeon crawl within one, should you be devoured.
5 detailed dungeon maps, 8 new creatures, the dark secrets of eternal youth and more!

boardgame.name: What We Give To Alien Gods
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Explore an abandoned temple adrift in the middle of Bermuda Triangle-like nebula. Search for the source of an interdiction field that rips ships traveling through the sector out of FTL Jumpspace. Discover the secrets of the ancient structure once devoted to the worship of an extraterrestrial entity, betrayed and imprisoned by the alien species that once revered it.

What We Give to Alien Gods is an existential, survival-style exploration adventure compatible with the Mothership sci-fi horror RPG by Tuesday Knight Games.

An exciting dungeon-crawl that can be run as a standalone module or inserted into part of an ongoing campaign
Roleplaying opportunities to explore character growth and the meaning of their player characters' existence
Editorial Notes and Warden Tips with fun facts, explanations on some of the tools used in the module, and suggestions on how to make the adventure come alive
Art, Stats, and Descriptions of the host of the extraterrestrial entities that players may encounter in the module
Maps and Illustrations, including Warden Aids and Player Handouts
Lots and lots and lots of tables for generating encounters, and more!

boardgame.name: The Burning of Carbex
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Burning of Carbex is a ~100-page three-act campaign compatible with the Mothership Sci-Fi Horror Roleplaying Game. A malevolent alien parasite has been freed and seeks to spread its corrupting influence far and wide.

Carbex was once covered in lush forests, before the fire. Everything burned, except for some silverfish-like insects who fled underground. Millenia later, coal miners break into their refuge.

About a week later, you are contacted by a nearby law enforcement agency. The Angelus Fabrica Station orbiting Carbex issued an automated distress signal after deploying every escape pod. 4 days of communication attempts without response met the persistent distress signal. The agency offers you a decent sum to determine the complete evacuation’s rationale and to rescue and assist, by any means necessary any remaining crew members. The Angelus Fabrica is a disaster, most of its residents having been killed or altered by the strange transformations these parasites affect in their hosts, The Creeping Perforation.

Meanwhile, another disaster is careening towards a much larger population, the Sineto Chem Solutions Deep Space Factory. On Carbex, deep within Sediment Hill coal mine, the parasites have coalesced horrifyingly and their minions are planning to spread across the stars.

boardgame.name: December
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Christmas comes early for a group of street kids, but their good fortune brings ill tidings for everyone else in their neighborhood. The source of the children’s windfall is the property of nefarious forces that would stop at nothing — including destroying the holiday — to recover what’s theirs.

December is a short adventure for Midnight Boulevard: 2D6 Adventure in the World of Film Noir. The adventure is also usable with Cepheus Engine and the Original Science Fiction Roleplaying Game.

boardgame.name: Baklin, Jewel of the Seas
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

“Oh Baklin, Jewel of the Seas, great gateway of Erillion! Minstrels sing of its wealth and marine power; and of the refinement and taste of its magnates and nobility. Minstrels of all kinds, of course, are prone to grandiloquence; and perhaps Baklin is neither as mighty nor as fair as the ballads claim. And yet, there is reason the minstrels sing so, for Baklin has wealthy patrons, its fleet is not inconsiderable – and are its streets not the loveliest within so many weeks of travel? Indeed, those who brave the high seas often believe so… and they will gladly pay for a song to remember their visit.”

A 72-page setting guide and adventure module for low to mid-level player characters, Baklin: Jewel of the Seas describes a medium-sized merchant city, including its rulers, criminal underworld, establishments, and three-level Undercity. Baklin is meant as both a campaign hub a party can depart from and return to (with numerous hooks for wilderness adventures), and as a complex adventure location of its own. It can be used along with the materials published for the Isle of Erillion mini-setting (Echoes #02–05), or it can double as almost any neutral-aligned port town in your own setting.

In any case, Baklin is meant to be played: it is focused on city intrigue, exploration, and dungeon crawling. Go shopping for great deals in port or at the stores of the reclusive Masters’ Guild; be careful not to fall afoul of the Sea Laws or anger the Knights of Yolanthus Kar; discover what lurks in the Tower of Gulls; and brave the Shrine of Roxana and the Thrones of Judgement!

This is two identical-length modules in one: a city guide with 39 major locations and a dungeon setting with 112 keyed areas, connected and bound together via multiple secret entrances, plot threads, and NPC agendas.

boardgame.name: Thistle and Hearth
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Thistle and Hearth is a game of dark, fairy-tale inspired stories set in a wintry village.
...
You live in a village beset by violence, scarcity, powerful and inscrutable entities, and spirits from beyond death. Together you cling to the small space that you have carved into a home, and do your best to find solace with one another.

boardgame.name: Hooked on You
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:


A crocheting game for 3 weavers
Map the path to love and ruin with mysteries and magic you weave yourself
Yarn, crochet hooks, paper, and pens will aid you

boardgame.name: House
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

This is a game about a house.

To play it, you will need two or more people, a sheet of paper, something to write with, and a deck of cards.

boardgame.name: I Expect You to Die
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You are the world’s most famous superspy, but you seem to have landed in a spot of trouble.

You have been captured and are being kept captive deep in the villain’s secret base. And as if that’s not bad enough, the villain and his henchmen have put you in a trap that is as ingenious as it is deadly, and you only have seconds to live!

Lucky for you, you have the skill, determination and wherewithal to get out of situations like this and win the day. Now, if you could just get your right hand free…

boardgame.name: Hello, World
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Hello, World is a game about a group of daring “users” (human-like people with thoughts and feelings, like you) building an immortal legacy in the networks of an uploaded society. There are heists, chases, intrigue, battles, negotiations, and mysteries to be uncovered about the code that sustains this World.

We play to find out if the fledgling crew can enact real change in World amidst the threats of rival organizations, powerful artificial entities, the indifference of an amnesiac society, and the erosion of your user’s own drifting consciousness.

boardgame.name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Black Bolt and Medusa
boardgame.description:
Blackagar Boltagon, known as Black Bolt, is the king of the Inhumans, a strain of humans genetically engineered by the Kree Empire to be living weapons. With his voice, Black Bolt harness immense power. When he speaks, he can produce a shockwave able to level a whole city. Even a whisper from Black Bolt renders his enemies feeble and broken. He has endured rigorous conditioning to control this power, choosing to remain totally silent. Only in defense of his people does Black Bolt unleash this power of his destructive voice.

Medusaligh Amaquelin-Boltagon, or Medusa, is the wife of Black Bolt and queen of the Inhumans. Through exposure to the Terrigen mists, she gained psychokinetic control over her hair. Each strand is stronger than steel and she can manipulate them like an array of countless appendages. She can whip her hair faster than the speed of sound or use it to bind someone in place. Medusa's control of her hair is so precise that she can use it to perform work as delicate as picking a lock or threading a needle.

Contents:
1 Black Bolt Miniature
1 Medusa Miniature
2 Bases
2 Character Stat Cards
4 Team Tactic Cards
1 Crisis Card
1 Affiliation Card
12 Tokens

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Marvel: Crisis Protocol – Crystal and Lockjaw
boardgame.description:
Crystalia Amaquelin is a princess of the Inhuman Royal Family and younger sister of Medusa, the Queen of the Inhumans. Like other Inhumans, Crystal was exposed to the Terrigen Mists at a young age to gain powers through Terrigenesis, acquiring the ability to psionically control the classic elements of air, earth, fire, and water. Crystal is often accompanied by her loyal companion, Lockjaw.

Lockjaw is a giant Inhuman bull dog with the power of incredible teleportation. He serves the Inhuman Royal Family as an escort and loyal protector-as well as a means of transportation. Lockjaw can teleport himself and those nearby anywhere he desires on the Earth or Moon. Lockjaw can also psionically track scents across dimensions and has an empathic bond to those he protects. If his wards are ever in danger, Lockjaw fiercely protects them with his incredible strength.

Contents:
1 Crystal Miniature
1 Lockjaw Miniature
2 Bases
2 Character Stat Cards
2 Team Tactic Cards
11 Tokens

boardgame.name: Football Season: Road to Glory
boardgame.description:
In Football Season, players take on the role of managers of a football club and need to control various aspects of the team such as hiring players, lineup, training, medical department and also taking care of the team's image. Over the course of 4 seasons the teams will dispute the national championship and fight for the title, but the opponents are not easy and it will be necessary to invest in the right areas to have the best team of all time.

Choose your starting 11, face the best teams in the tournament, but watch out for injuries that can take your ace off the field. Invest in a good coach or improve your training conditions, send scouts to attract new talents and even compete in the Cup for chances to increase your income. In the end, the best manager will be the one who has achieved the most success with his new club.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Mulheres Machonas no Planeta dos Macacos
boardgame.description:
From Publisher Website:

Este quarto e último volume escrito no Brasil tira sarro da macacada, do holocausto e do que sobrou no planeta. Agora sim o círculo se fecha e ficamos aguardando qualquer coisa absurda para tirarmos mais sarro.

boardgame.name: Alsa Ludo
boardgame.description:
With Alsa Ludo, rediscover alone, with family or friends, the cultural riches of Alsace, by playing with 160 puzzle cards with detailed statements.

Among the many topics covered; Castles of Alsace & Alsatian Traditions: construction and specificities of many castles, famous people or families, significant events, village festivals, local law, gastronomy, costume, dialect, legends, tourist routes, music...

Object of the game: reach 10 points!

boardgame.name: One Page WWII: Tank War Ardennes
boardgame.description:
Cadet!
You are a tank commander during the Battle of the Bulge in WWII.
The Ardennes forest is a harsh climate, and the cold December timing of the battle is sure to try you and your crew.
Your orders are to sweep the area for German units and drive them back, clearing the way for the Allies to invade Germany and END THIS WAR!

One Page WWII: Tank War Ardennes is a solitaire roll and write wargame where you record everything on a single sheet of paper.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: History: World War II (Battle of the Bulge)

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Magnytour Profil: Championnat d'Europe
boardgame.description:
190 km of flat is on the program in 2019 for the title.

Theoretically, it's an ultra-flat profile in the Netherlands which should allow sprinters to become European champions, but beware of the verges.

boardgame.name: Carbondale
boardgame.description:
Carbondale is a tile-laying game played with standard playing cards. Players have just moved to the small town of Carbondale, and lay cards in a grid representing the social and business networks they are working to develop. By playing clubs, they can win hearts; by buying spades, they can gain diamonds. The winner is the first to have in their networks three hearts and seven diamonds, or three diamonds and seven hearts. If a card in a player's network is not sufficiently protected, it is vulnerable to take-over by opponents. Players will need skill in tile-laying to advance quickly and safely, and will have to carefully manage their hand to balance cards for offense, defense, and building.

The only equipment required is standard decks of cards.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Black Card Revoked: Still Petty Edition
boardgame.description: Black Card Revoked: Still Petty Edition is a 36-card expansion for any edition of Black Card Revoked created in partnership with website The Shade Room.

boardgame.name: Eskalating Eskatons
boardgame.description:
Publisher summary
Tired of spending Omens with reckless abandon and no consequence?

Want to spice up your miserable final days?

Eskalating Eskatons ties the players' spending of Omens to the Calendar of Nechrubel with a nifty rule and tracker. Formatted with both a printer-loathing and printer-friendly spread in one file (plus a secret bonus loyalty card version).

boardgame.name: Big Trouble: Winter Hero
boardgame.description:
From publisher description:
Winter Hero is a cold weather themed hero/monster card supplement for the Big Trouble RPG series. It includes 6 new heroes and 4 new monsters not featured in any other supplement or module. All hero/monster cards and minis are in both color and black & white.

Included heroes are: Polar Explorer, Storm Chaser, Ice Sculptor, Baker, Snowboarder, and Figure Skater.

Included monsters are: Mutant Snow Flea, Baird's Shrew, Ermine (boss), and Snowy Owl (boss).

Requires: Big Trouble Settings Guide and Rules

boardgame.name: Stronghold: Undead (Second Edition) – Phantom Dragon Expansion
boardgame.description:
Use Phantom Dragon to destroy the gate for alternate win condition: Destroying the third gate equals breaching the stronghold and fulfilling the Invader's Victory condition.

As a necromancer you will be able to raise the most powerful of your units, The Phantom Dragon. He will be beating down on Stronghold's newfound gates, making it another possible route to victory. It will not stop. Each time you will put mana into summoning it, it will grow stronger. However, that's not the only way Phantom Dragon grows. He will be also powered up by panic on the walls. For ever point on panic marker this creature will grow stronger.

This expansion is a redesigned version of the old rules for Gate from the first edition of the game. It includes new rules for Invader and Defender side.

So brace for impact poor souls inside a stronghold, because the real nightmare just started.


Note: Although it was delivered in a small separate box, one of its components (a big gate token, which would not fit in this small box) was included INSIDE the KS edition of the base game.

boardgame.name: Klettermäuse
boardgame.description:
The little mice want to grab the juicy apples that the wind has shaken from the tree. But here comes the sly fox, who also likes to eat apples. The little mice quickly climb the apple tree to hide. In order to get to the ripe apples in the meadow, the mice climb up and down: The little climbing mice hang onto each other and rappel down the tree. But who is the fastest and grabs the most apples from the meadow?

Two dice depicting different colors are rolled in turns. The main task for the players is to pay attention and react fast by finding the matching color combination of double-colored mice tokens by putting their hands on them.

Whoever gets the right mice first may take them - and either hang them on his branch of the large apple tree in the center of the table or - if they don't match in color - keep them for a later turn.

When a wind icon is rolled, the mice on the branches may be re-sorted and can be put together with the same colored sides, hanging from a branch in a domino-like fashion. If the chain of mice reaches 5 tokens, they get to the ground and players may pick up an apple token. The player, who gets to 2 apples first, wins the game.

—user summary

listing.notes:
Spieleranzahl: 2 bis 4 Spieldauer: 15 Minuten Altersempfehlung: ab 5 Jahre
Meine Lieblingsspiele: Klettermäuse Die kleinen Mäuse wollen sich die saftigen Äpfel schnappen, die der Wind vom Baum geschüttelt hat. Doch da kommt schon der schlaue Fuchs, der auch gerne Äpfel frisst. Schnell klettern die kleinen Mäuse auf den Apfelbaum, um sich zu verstecken. Um dennoch an die reifen Äpfel auf der Wiese zu gelangen, geht es mäusemunter hoch und runter: Die kleinen Klettermäuse hängen sich aneinander und seilen sich vom Baum ab. Doch wer ist am schnellsten und schnappt sich so die meisten Äpfel von der Wiese?
https://youtu.be/QIWTJFOjr4w
Inhalt: 1 Apfelbaum 4 Äste 1 Fuchs 1 Wiese 25 Klettermaus-Anhänger 2 Würfel 4 Symbol-Chips 5 Apfel-Chips
Mit Spielregeln in folgenden Sprachen: DE

boardgame.name: Rogue Heroes: Ruins of Tasos
boardgame.description:
Explore an expansive overworld to uncover secrets and ANCIENT dungeons

Adventure solo, or assemble a team of up to 4 heroes!

Choose your class! Explore the overworld and build up your town to unlock new classes, each with their own abilities, stats, and style!

Upgrade Everything! Use the treasures you find in the dungeons to add new buildings and shops to your town, Upgrade your house, your weapons, your equipment, your abilities, you name it!

Conquer Enemies, Puzzles, and Traps for Gems
Destroy monsters in the Dungeons to collect Gems, Gold, and Monster Parts. Bring them back to your town and trade them with the villagers to upgrade your Heroes, Equipment and even the town itself! Survive the Dungeon’s traps and puzzles long enough to gather what you need to improve until you can take them down once and for all!

Endless Dungeons
Dungeon layouts are generated each time you enter, changing up the rooms, paths, traps, and enemies. No two runs are the same!

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Spatial Delivery
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

You are an intergalactic courier with a package to deliver.

All you have for an address is a name and coordinates
leading to some kind of space station. But you work for the
most reliable delivery company in the galaxy, and you’ll be
damned if you’re going to lose your bonus.

boardgame.name: Dread Encounters
boardgame.description:
"Dread Encounters: 13 Horrifying Hooks for Ravenloft brings you all-new encounters for any Curse of Strahd campaign, or any other adventure that takes you through the mist-strewn vales of Barovia!

This supplement includes 13 new encounters and adventure hooks, new antagonists and NPCs, and adds horrific and tragic side stories for players to engage with."

(Author Summary)

boardgame.name: Dark Fortean Times: Pwdre Sêr
boardgame.description:
From the designer:

Fiery orbs have been seen falling from the luminiferous aether. Awestruck by unnatural oily hues smeared across the sunless sky, your gang of misfit “heroes” chooses the cardinal direction last which they spied the meteor’s tail - North, South, East, or West?

In lieu of the Weather table, roll on the Pwdre Sêr supplement for alternative meteoric calamities.

boardgame.name: Roadside Banditry
boardgame.description:
From the designers:

Roadside Banditry is a fully illustrated content pack that can be used to generate special bandit groups with unique features to be used as enemies in your TTRPG game. It contains 20 cards, split into 4 categories: Gangs, Members, Tactics & Loot. By combining one of each, you'll have a group of exceptional bandit enemies ready to plug into your game. Roadside Banditry is written by Willem Greve in collaboration with Bodie Hartley (SlowQuest) and fully digitally illustrated by Willem Greve.

This product is written with 5E rules in mind, but should be easy to convert into other systems.

boardgame.name: Uprising: Curse of the Last Emperor – Arch-Nemesis Expansion
boardgame.description:
Not only does this expansion feature 4 new races (Tua Than, Hokqan, Ytuma and the Renegade Legion), but it has 4 super-huge endbosses! There are 2 Arch-Nemesis for The Empire (The Drakoliche and The Empress), and 2 for Chaos (The Kraken and The Harvester). They replace the usual Hordes and Legions on your last Chapter - but how do they get there? Read the Omens to find out what your future holds...

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Uprising: Curse of the Last Emperor

boardgame.name: Coats & Hats
boardgame.description:
These coats and hats are terribly disorganized. Group them by colour to win!

Coats & Hats is a tiny card game packed with coats and hats that need sorting. Match the colour of the items on a rack, while preventing your opponent from doing the same.

Each turn, add a card to the outer edge of the rack; then either use a special ability on a card, or flip your card — there's a hat on the back of each coat. Group three items of the same colour and you score!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Card Shark Pool
boardgame.description:
It's like pool, but with cards.

Card Shark Pool is a light-weight, casual card and dice game for two players. Plan your shots, clear the table.

There are no complex calculations for angle or rebounds. Roll dice based on the length of the shot, and use special abilities on each card to draw, roll, and carom.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Alien Database
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Twenty aliens for your game sessions.

Each alien entry includes further information like combat & tactics, habitat and biology.

boardgame.name: Toymakers
boardgame.description:
With just 18 cards and no other components, Toymakers is a full worker placement game; collect resources, construct buildings, make toys, spread joy!

Toymakers uses a resource management mechanism where the card you place your worker on is taken into your hand for resources. The cards double as buildings which provide more resources in a single action, and also can be upgraded to a toy, scoring you points! Time your upgrades correctly; when the last card is drawn from the middle of the table, the game ends!

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamefamily: Contests: Button Shy Game Design Contests and Challenges

boardgame.name: Подводные города: Ибица промокарта
boardgame.description:
Grants 3 Credits and 1 VP during the Production phase.

boardgame.name: Bór
Brew
Sylve
브루: 마법의 물약
boardgame.description:
Bring balance back to the forest!

Time is broken and shattered. The seasons all exist at once, and day and night have no real cycle — they rotate at the whim of the forest. This enchanted land has been driven into chaos and it's up to you, the cunning mystics of the forest, to tame extraordinary woodland creatures and use your magic to bring back balance.

In Brew, players must choose how to use element dice, either to take back control of as many seasons as possible in an area-control game or to procure goods at the local village in a worker-placement game. Recruiting woodland creatures and brewing potions can help offset chance die-rolls or create an engine to help you tame the lands.

BREW - Bring das Gleichgewicht in den Wald zurück Die Zeit ist zerbrochen, die Jahreszeiten existieren alle auf einmal und Tag und Nacht haben ihren Rhythmus verloren - alles dreht sich nach der Laune des Waldes. Dieses verzauberte Land wurde ins Chaos gestürzt und es liegt an euch, den listigen Mystikern des Waldes, außergewöhnliche Waldkreaturen zu zähmen und eure Magie einzusetzen, um das Gleichgewicht wiederherzustellen.
In Brew müssen die Spieler entscheiden, wie sie die Elementwürfel einsetzen, entweder um die Kontrolle über so viele Jahreszeiten wie möglich zu erlangen (Area-Control) oder um Waren im Dorf zu beschaffen (Worker-Placement). Durch das Fangen von Waldkreaturen und das Brauen von Tränken können die Würfelwürfe manipuliert werden. So wird eine Engine geschaffen, die dabei hilft, die Zeit und das Land wieder in Harmonie zu bringen.

boardgame.name: Hands of the Devil
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Beware when dealing with devils! The Abomination Vaults sprawl far beneath the mysterious Gauntlight, and it's time to take weapons, torches, and wits into the deeper dungeons. Here, vile fleshcrafters labor to create armies of monsters for their long-dead leader, and a force of devils still work to maintain order among the feral and fractious monsters. An unlikely ally can reveal the secrets of the Abomination Vaults, but his price is steep and must be paid in blood.

"Hands of the Devil" is a Pathfinder adventure for four 5th-level characters. This adventure continues the Abomination Vaults Adventure Path, a three-part, monthly campaign in which the heroes explore a sprawling megadungeon to stop an ancient evil from renewing her monstrous vengeance. This adventure also includes a close look at the wicked will-o'-wisps, an examination of Golarion's fleshcrafters, and new rules and monsters!

Newleaf introduces brand new critters, constructions, and exciting events to draw Visitor cards to your blossoming city! It also features the Train Station Board, resource-delivering Train Cars, travel-worthy Tickets, and Reservation Tokens!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: FRITZO Cube
boardgame.description:
The FRITZO Cube is an innovative and sophisticated game for almost all age groups. Each cube consists of 27 cubes. Each individual cube is unique in its color arrangement. The ingenious thing about it: Depending on the game variant, the dice have to be placed next to each other so that they have to meet different or matching colors in all directions.

Players earn points based on rows and "staircases" and player with the highest score wins.

—description from publisher

boardgame.name: Bridge City Poker
boardgame.description:
In Bridge City Poker, players compete to get rid of the cards in their hands (or "shed") by playing different sets of cards (or “melds”) over a series of tricks before the deck runs out. Players will have to manage their ever-growing hands with game-breaking power cards. At the end of a round, players will burn a bridge (or “suit”) of choice completely from their hands. Finally, all players will score points based on their remaining cards and, after a set number of rounds, lowest score wins.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Lines of Fixation
boardgame.description:
Lines of Fixation is an abstract strategy game for 2players, inspired by Lines of Action (LoA). As same as LoA, it also has several game pieces start from a distance, the object to unite own pieces and some move constraints, but unlike LoA, it uses a hexagonal board and stacking mechanics.

GAMEPLAY (overview)
Setup each 9 of 2-height stacks as the diagram above. Light color player goes first, alternate turns taking one move with a stack their control (That is, a stack with your color at the top).

Stacks move a straight line the distance exactly its height, dropping bottom disks exactly one by one for each hex. Dropped disks may capture opponent's stacks and/or merge with own stacks. If your mono-color stack of 3- or more height can make capture, you must do so.

And there are important restrictions; if you do not have the highest stack on a straight line, your stacks on the line cannot make any move along the line. And if both of you and your opponent have the highest stacks of same height on a line, your stacks on the line can move and merge but cannot capture.

The object is to make all stacks you control adjacent each other as a group. You can also win by having two bi-color stacks of 6-height.

-description from designer

boardgame.name: Pic Flip
boardgame.description:
Pic Flip is a card game from 7 years and up, which provides rapid fun when turning the cards over quickly.
The game principle is so easy to understand that even the youngest can play independently.
Children especially like the rapid hunt for matching cards. Whoever is the first player or first player to turn all cards over and down the fastest wins.
Develops concentration, identification and dexterity and is lots of fun.

Pit your wits against Nightweave and her sticky schemes in solo or two-player games, and recruit heroes of yore from the More Legends and Corrin Evertail expansion packs as well as transform your farms with our new Through Every Season expansion pack!

boardgame.name: Everdell: The Complete Collection
boardgame.description:
Dive tailfirst into the world of Everdell with the Complete Collection. Build a city of critters and constructions and explore the Emerald Valley and beyond; celebrate the Bellfaire, wonder at Newleaf’s mechanical marvels, trek into the Spirecrest Mountains, explore the underwater depths of Pearlbrook, and chance the dangers of Mistwood. Play against automated opponents including the dastardly Rugwort and cunning Nightweave and meet heroes of renown like Corrin Evertail himself. Everdell is easy to learn, yet offers satisfying strategic depth and endless replayability. Will the sun shine brightest on your city?

Everdell Complete Collection contains 23 different types of Critter meeples, player powers for asymmetric play, Giant Critters with saddles to ride on, and an amazing array of pieces including wooden twigs, squishy berries, smooth pebbles, amber resin, glass pearls, and more. Featuring deluxe components, including the shiny metal point tokens and the wooden Ever Tree, this Complete Collection is the ultimate edition of Everdell.

Includes all content from:

- Everdell
- Pearlbrook
- Spirecrest
- Bellfaire
- Newleaf
- Mistwood
- Wooden Ever Tree
- Collector's upgrade packs (Freshwater, Glimmergold, and Trailblazers)
- Everdell Big Ol' Box of Storage

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Nasty Neighbors
boardgame.description:
In this game, all players are neighbors in an apartment building. However, living in a crowded block can test your nerves, especially when you have Nasty Neighbors.

After each attack you're unable to prevent, you'll pop a pill to calm your nerves. However, take too many and you're eliminated from the game.

Your goal is to force the other neighbors to leave and be declared "Lord of the Building!"

If a neighbor runs out of pills, their nervous system can't take the stress - they are forced to leave the building.

In the end, there is only one survivor... or NONE!

A dynamic game of strategy, observation, humor, and luck... everything you need to stay sane with bad neighbors.

—description from the designer
